reviews/3/comments: This home was wonderful and in a great location. Very close to the peak 9 lift and Main Street. The home was clean and had everything we needed. Darla was very responsive and helped with anything that we needed. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here.

name: Breckenridge | Peak 10 | Ski in/out
reviews/0/comments: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! There was plenty of space for 9 of us and the house was comfortable, well stocked and surprisingly quiet, considering the number of people. We loved using the ski down trail in the mornings and the easy shuttle ride back home in the afternoons. The hot tub was amazing! We saw a beautiful fox in the yard two separate days which was pretty cool. We highly recommend this property for a larger group who wants to all stay under the same roof. It was great!
reviews/1/comments: Lovely home with easy access to slopes. Couldn’t have been more pleased with our stay.
reviews/2/comments: This place will meet and exceed all of your expectations.   The location is  fabulous!  The pictures do not do it justice. It is beautiful.   We had very comfortable beds with more than enough linens , towels, paper products, shampoo and soap.   There were even separate towels for the hot tub.    Liz and Nathan were very responsive when we had questions.
reviews/3/comments: This home was a pleasure to stay at.  There was plenty of room for all of us to go and have quiet time or enjoy all of us in the kitchen/living room.   We even had a yoga session in the basement for 5 people!  The 10 minute shuttle (available every 15 minutes)  was so close for us to venture into downtown for food, drinks or shopping and also get to the closest ski slope.  Helpful Note for experienced skiiers- there is a trail you can actually take at the end of our street that takes you to a slope instead of using the shuttle.  We didn't know there was a shuttle "app" that showed you exactly when the shuttle was near so you could wait in the house until it arrived.  Don't forget to drink, drink drink WATER!  :)

name: Village Walk 55 - Four Bedroom
reviews/0/comments:
What a beautiful home and fantastic location! The house was even better than expected; each bedroom has its own bathroom and everything is very well appointed. The house very comfortably sleeps 8, and our group was very pleased with everything.

Our only disappointment (and reason for subtracting 1 star) was that the hot tub was not operational during our stay. I had messaged the host ahead of time and was assured that the hot tub was available, so our group was disappointed when this was not the case. To their credit, the host did apologize for the mixup and it sounds like a new hot tub is being installed very soon.

I’d definitely recommend this home if you are looking for place in Beaver Creek - thanks!!
reviews/1/comments: We enjoyed our stay at Beaver Creek Mountain Lodging for the second year in a row! Location is perfect. We can easily walk down to the village to the restaurants, lifts, shopping, etc. Vail is only a quick 15-minute drive and Breckenridge is about a 45-minute drive. The house itself is lovely with lots of room for privacy when traveling in large groups. We love the washer/dryer, large den, play room with poker table and amazing kitchen. We sat on the deck every morning drinking our coffee. The backyard is full of aspen trees and a beautiful creek. We can’t wait to be back next year!
reviews/2/comments: Location, location, location!
reviews/3/comments: It was a wonderful family experience.  The house was lovely, spacious and very well equipped.  I highly recommend the location, and the East West Destination company who made our stay most pleasant!!  We will definitely return to do it all again.

name: Carriage Way
Monarch at Shock Hill: Elegant Home w/ Hot Tub, Fi
PH Breckenridge New Years 2BD Great Skiing/Views
reviews/0/comments: OVERSTATED, OVERSTATED, OVERSTATED. This is not a two-bedroom penthouse. It is two separate standalone units, 1420A & 1420B. These units are not on the top floor, which is what a penthouse should be. They are on the 4th floor and there is a 5th floor in this building. Both units are small, especially 1420B, and you will be deeply disappointed. Per one of the managers of The Grand Colorado, this host receives lots of complaints for misrepresenting his place. It does not sleep 8 comfortably as he says on his listing. This unit sleeps 4 comfortably. If you want to stay at this building, do yourself a favor, and rent it directly from the Grand Colorado. Go to Grand (Website hidden by Airbnb) and you will see that Unit 1420A is the One-Bedroom Breckenridge Residence. You will pay a lot less and you will deal with someone who is honest with you about what you are actually renting. Also, our toilets didn't work, the towels were like you get at a one-star hotel, the shower/tub in unit 1420B is too small to use if you are taller than 5'8",  and the fireplace is on a timer. These two separate units are definitely not LUXURY, LUXURY, LUXURY. On a positive note, the location is great for skiing and the view is good.
reviews/0/response:
OVERSTATED? OR is the guest review inaccurate, lacking in detail and candor? This review certainly fails to mention guest-host communication before and after the stay that can be interpreted as attempts to manipulate the host and policies of Airbnb and further influence the guest’s review of the property and stay. Firstly, there was the guest’s attempt to cancel his reservation (made in October) three days before his December 26th check-in. As a member of Airbnb for several years, the guest was certainly aware of my Firm cancellation policy but claimed ignorance about this matter. After repeated badgering by the guest via emails through Airbnb, I had to have Airbnb step in and deal with him directly. Lastly, his final email to me through Airbnb was an attempt to extort money from me for “misrepresentlng” my property. He was giving me “the opportunity to make this right before I post a review” and “hopefully, we can work things out so I don’t have to contact Airbnb and file a formal complaint”.

OVERSTATED! Guilty as charged! The 2 BD Breckenridge style residence at the Grand Colorado on Peak 8 resort is approximately 1300 sq. ft. It consists of a 1 BD Master “A” residence interconnected and attached to a Suite “B” residence. The Master “A” residence has its own private bedroom with king-sized bed, private full bath, full kitchen, living room with a fold-out queen sleeper sofa, attached dining area, and two TVs. The Suite “B” residence has its own private bedroom with a king-sized bed, private full bath, a bonus kitchenette, and a living room suite with a TV and queen-sized sleeper sofa. Please accept my apologies for giving you MORE than a standard 2 BD unit.

All residences in Building 1, where you were located, are on floors 1-4. The fifth floor of Building 1 houses the Breckenridge Grand Vacation sales and business offices. Your 2 BD residence is a top floor (4th floor) premium end unit that is off set from the fifth floor, with no neighbors on either side and no one except the Almighty and the stars above. No unobstructed views, nor increases in foot traffic. It is a penthouse residence facing immediately onto the ski slopes, with panoramic views of the mountains. Again, I apologize for giving you MORE than a standard 2 BD unit.

It is extremely interesting someone would say that I, as a first-time host on Airbnb, “receives lots of complaints for misrepresenting this place.” At your insistence, additional daily housekeeping was provided at my expense, despite the front desk providing you with information at check-in regarding housekeeping services and what to expect during your stay. Because of your expressed disappointment that your penthouse residence should somehow be different than other residences abiding by the resort policy, they sent up a wine basket to your penthouse. Also, there were only two reported maintenance issues during your stay. Both were addressed and resolved.

Perhaps requesting preferential treatment and bending the rules for personal benefit is your modus operandi. is it fair to disparage a host and a world-class resort in doing so?

The Mont Blanc Home - sleeps up to 19 guests
reviews/0/comments: I've vacationed in Breck for more than 10 ski seasons and this was by far my best experience. Location was superb, a short walk from the house lands you at the Base 8 lodges. Take the lifts up the slopes or ride the Gondola into town. The house is sprawling and spacious, with plenty of great gathering spots. Can't wait to book this place again when lockdown is over.
reviews/1/comments: Big house with a lot of room and great amenities. Comfortably accommodated our large group. Everyone loved the place!
reviews/2/comments:
Great homebase for our groups ski trip. Lots of large bedrooms and bathrooms (as described) for sleeping but also great common spaces for socializing and recharging after a day on the mountain. The layout is a bit eccentric so make sure to check out the nooks and crannies. We cooked in most nights and the place is well suited for both cooking and eating in large groups. Carol and the team were very responsive to our few questions and checkin process was seamless.

The home is not quite ski in/out but it is a short walk (15 min in ski boots) to the base of peak 8. On the way home there is a short cut through the woods that make it a 5 min walk home. Read the sign by the garage for more details.

We were never able to figure out the town shuttles so my advice would be drive or Uber if you are heading into town. It takes about 10 min by car and lots of good options.
reviews/3/comments: Great location!
reviews/4/comments: Amazing House.
reviews/5/comments: Carol was a great host! Easy to get in touch with and eager to help. The Mont blanc itself was built with exceptional design. Beautiful and open layout
reviews/6/comments: Great venue for a large group needing multiple bedrooms for mostly couples. Hot tub was great! Very clean with a nice welcome basket. Close to a free trolley stop and minutes from the free gondola going down to Breck or up for other activities.
reviews/6/response: We loved having you and hope that we'll see you again in the high country!
reviews/7/comments:
If you're looking for a FANTASTIC place to stay with beautiful views, great location, and an awesome house then this is the place. I went for a wedding reception with a group of 15 close friends and we could not have had a better time while there.

Being able to walk into town was so great and let us be at ease when trying to transport a larger group around with limited cars. Anything we did want to do, hiking, rafting, sightseeing, etc was all a short drive away.

The house itself was way past our expectations and there was plenty of room for our group and then some. The pictures don't really do the size of the house justice.

Carol and her team were fantastic as well. Anytime we had a question they were a call and fast response away. We can't be more thankful that we had such a great stay to help take just one more thing off our mind before the wedding.
reviews/7/response: Hi Briannan!  We loved having your group and hope to see you in the future!

We enjoyed our stay and didn't face any problem.
reviews/2/comments: Incredible location.  Wonderful few days. So happy we could walk out straight onto the slopes. The apartment is warm, spacious and comfortable.  We will be back!
reviews/3/comments: Good location and lovely view. The staff at the Top of the Village were very responsive and the shuttle service was great. Accomodation was as expected. Also the second bedroom was very cold kids had to sleep in extra clothes.
reviews/4/comments: The host gave us clear instruction and warm welcome through emails.  We checked in easily and entered a very nice and clean condo facing ski slope with beautiful fall foliage. We also enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi in the community.  Overall, it was a great experience and we strongly recommend this condo.

reviews/0/comments: What a lovely home. Right in the middle of the historic district in Breckenridge. Only a block from Main Street with its bars, restaurants and shopping. The home also has a fantastic kitchen which was very welcome during this difficult time with the pandemic. The home is only a short (7minute) walk from skiing (Quicksilver Chair). Mike was an excellent host and we look forward to our next visit.
reviews/1/comments:
After various visits to Breck staying at different hotels/houses, we definitely believe Michael's house has been the most beautiful and with the very best location of all...walking distance to the slopes, to the supermarket, to the Cookie Shop, to the Crepes :) and to the many different experiences on Main Street. Additionally, the house is beautifully decorated, and each detail makes the stay even more special... The view of the mountains from the main area (living room, dining room, kitchen..) is spectacular, and the convenience that the house offers with four rooms, each with its own bathroom, is perfect for a big family group. We enjoyed a very special and memorable New Year's vacation!!

Thank you very much Michael for sharing your beautiful house with our family and we hope to return soon...All the best to you and your family!
reviews/2/comments: Great place for our family. Super convenient to downtown. We are non skiers and had an awesome Christmas holiday. The Christmas tree made the holiday for the kids
reviews/3/comments: Amazing house and amazing location!  Highly recommend

name: Spring Break @Grand Colorado Peak 8
STRESSLESS IN SNOWMASS
reviews/0/comments: Excellent house, super spacious, super clean, and equipped with everything that someone would need. Daryl is very nice and responds instantly. Fantastic location, amazing views. Although the house is not ski-in ski-out, its less than 5 minutes drive to the Snowmass ski center. We had a great stay, we would go back.
reviews/1/comments:
Stressless in Snowmass is absolute perfection as far as house rentals go. As you come up the driveway you know you are in for a treat. This home is immaculate and beautifully outfitted. Tons of natural light. Gorgeous mountain views from every room in this house. Everything you need in the kitchen and more. The televisions and WiFi are as good as it gets. Stressless is more comfortable than a five star resort because it’s all yours; no sharing the fireplace, the lobby, or the hot tub! The set up was beyond ideal for our group. So many options for spreading out and at the same time the large living/dining/kitchen area was perfect for convening. We were traveling with our two daughters and their spouses and one three year old grandchild. The three bedrooms with king beds are true master en-suite and very private and spacious. The location is just a few minutes drive to the center of Snowmass Village. I personally did not ski and LOVED staying behind and relaxing in the house. My family members had a blast on the slopes and reported that parking was easy and the slopes were not at all over crowded during the holiday week. Daryl is very easy to communicate with and answered all questions practically immediately. Don’t hesitate to reserve this home!



Sent from my iPad
reviews/2/comments: This is a beautiful home with a fantastic host.  The great room whole top floor has awesome views from all sides.  It was the perfect gathering place for our family after a full day of skiing.  This is stressless and fantastic in Snowmass.
reviews/3/comments: Our stay at "Stressless in Snowmass" was wonderful.  Be aware that the photos on the Airbnb site do not do the property justice.  It is a spacious, beautifuly renovated high-end property in a stunning location, which is difficult to convey photographically (it sits high up, with views of the valley below from both sides of the house - all located five minutes by car from Snowmass village).  We found the resident parking adjacent to the slopes particularly convenient (by parking in lot 12 and walking a short distance between the condos to the slopes) and thoroughly enjoyed the hot tub after a day at the slopes.  We also found Daryl to be very friendly and responsive when it came to addressing any issues (although there were none of any consequence) or answering general questions.  We would definitely consider staying at "Stressless in Snowmass" in the future if we can ever gather ten family members together for a ski trip again!
reviews/3/response:
Hi Nathan,
Thank you so much for your kind words. We hope to see you back soon at Stressless in Snowmass. Wishing you and your family and happy and healthy new year!
Daryl

reviews/0/comments: great spot! Jason was awesome and super responsive!
reviews/0/response: Thank you Allison.  It was wonderful to have you and your large group at the home.   You are welcome back any time.  We are booking out now for Ski Season (spring break is already booked!).  Travel safe and we will be sure to stop and visit your business when in Denver.
reviews/1/comments: Our stay was amazing for a family birthday celebration! Jason was incredibly helpful. He reduced the amount of time and effort needed to plan an amazing trip. He provided restaurant and catering recommendations, activity ideas, and even helped us plan an incredible scavenger hunt that winded from the house to town. Each stop on the scavenger hunt was a Breckenridge attraction, so it felt like a self-guided tour. The house has amazing amenities and was exactly what was shown online. We will definitely be returning! Thank you to Jason and your entire team.
reviews/2/comments: What a great day! Jason is a wonderful host with great communication and all kinds of insight to the local area. The home is absolutely beautiful. We are already hoping to come back in the winter
reviews/2/response: Shelly, thank you so much.   Our goal is to make sure all of our guest get the most out of Breckenridge.    We would love to have the group back at any time.   Winters book out quickly due to the location and size of this home, so just be sure to plan ahead.  Until then, travel safe.
reviews/3/comments: This home was everything and more. It was perfectly located,  clean and the host could not have been friendlier! Jason kept in touch with us throughout our whole stay and made sure we had everything we needed & gave suggestions on so many local favorite restaurants, personal chef, shopping, events, hiking trails, etc… Staying here made our vacation so much more relaxing & enjoyable. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
reviews/3/response: Thank you William!  It is amazing that you coordinated your whole family and extended family to come together and stay with us.  Please keep us in mind next time as you know we have multiple homes on the same street that we can combine so you can be together, and have some space apart in the evenings.   Travel safe and see hope to see you again soon!
reviews/4/comments: Beautiful home, great location.  Ideal for a family reunion and for those who like to watch foxes while eating breakfast!
reviews/4/response: Thank you Vinod.   We enjoyed hosting you and are glad you could re-connect with family and spend a week here.   Our kids enjoy naming the busy foxes every year, his unofficial name is Wyatt.   We hope to see you again next year.
reviews/5/comments: Jason was so responsive and accommodating! The house was just awesome! Perfect Colorado trip with family!
reviews/5/response: Jeffrey, we agree this home is really great for families.  It is one of our top rented units for that reason.   We would love to have you back, stay in touch.
reviews/6/comments:
I cannot say enough about this place. If you have a larger group and have pets that accompany you on your travels like we do, there's no place better in Breckenridge. The views of the mountain (peak 9 I believe) are spectacular from the living room and kitchen and outside from the grill/lounge area and hot tub.

Jason, our host, went out of his way to chat with us before our stay and gave us plenty of options for things to do outside of the home, in town and around the area in general. So when he gives you the opportunity to chat, take him up on the offer. He is very personable, knowledgable and is a great host.

The kitchen had all the cookware and utensils that we could ever want and need for our stay. The common areas and game room/extra living room were perfect for separation from kids playing and adults talking. All the bedrooms were used on this trip and everyone was happy with how comfortable the beds were and that there were enough linens and towels. There's also a convenient washer and dryer to use also.

As the information on the house says, there's no need for air conditioning. In fact, the heat turned on in most rooms every evening, even though it's the middle of summer. There is plenty of space in the two car garage for vehicles and extra coolers and plenty of space in the driveway for additional vehicles.

If you're up early enough, you might get to see a fox like we did each morning. Morning coffee doesn't get much better than that. Our last day we also saw a moose with her youngsters. It was a pretty dang majestic way to end our time there at this beautiful home in Breckenridge.

If it's available, book this place as soon as possible. You won't regret it.

Mike & Joy
reviews/6/response:
Mike, we are so happy that you and your family could enjoy time together and build memories in this home. This home defiantly built for multi-generational family get togethers and the main reason we love it.

The moose and fox are majestic, I wish we could take credit for that but that is all mother nature. Until next time travel safe and keep us in mind for any of the properties we manage.
reviews/7/comments: Jason, is a pleasure to work with, he is genuinely concerned that his customers get the utmost enjoyment out of their stay. Whitecloud is a beautiful home that is spacious and situated in the perfect quiet area.
reviews/7/response: Naftali, thank you so much for the kind words.   We do love helping our guest experience the most that Breckenridge has to offer.   You and your large group are welcome back any time.  Thank you!
reviews/8/comments:
This is a fabulous house! Jason has to be the best AirBNB host we have ever had. He’s full of local knowledge and tips.

The house and check-in were seamless. Everything worked perfectly. Stocked with everything you could ever need. Quick 5 min shuttle ride/drive to the base. Tons of space for our party of 10 to spread out. We appreciated that the house was super kiddie friendly and had toys/books on hand!

We hope to be back again soon!
reviews/8/response:
Thank you Gillian. We would love to have you back, some people are starting to say that summer is even better than winter. We love both seasons. As you know this house books out 100% due to its fun floor plan and prime location, so plan ahead.
Travel safe and we hope to see you again soon.
reviews/9/comments:
EVERYTHING WE NEEDED FOR OUR CREW!

So many amazing things to say about this house and the host.

I will start with Jason, the host. From the time we booked, Jason was in contact. He had so much passion for sharing Breck and his house. With all his recommendations from coffee shops, restaurants, chef, grocery delivery, transportation etc. he made it easier getting acquainted with Breck before actually getting there. HIs detailed descriptions of the house, what was there, how close to town, to ski in/out etc. Again made it so much easier traveling to a new destination. Lastly Jason is very accommodating and understanding. Our turo car was delivered a day before we got there and wasn't picked up til a day after we left - and he was so helpful and understanding, while I felt terrible.

The house: AMAZING, had everything you need to never want to leave after a long day on the mountain. Hot tub was clean and just outside on the deck off the living room. Game room, the kids never left except to ski. Beds and bedrooms, super comfy and good sizes. The Kitchen had more than you could ever need for our big crew. Grill outside was great for cooking dinner. Garage was big and clean with a place to leave ski's/snowboards. I could go on forever but in short there wasn't one thing we needed that we didn't have at this house. The shuttle for the neighborhood literally picked up in front of the house and dropped off to quicksilver chair lift peak 9, every 12 minutes from 8am to 8pm. Town is about a 4-5 min drive, we got a car which we used on occasion and we were happy we did - allowed us more freedom to go into town to eat/shop etc. The ski in/ski out worked for most of our crew and we used it sometimes, and other times the shuttle, but definitely talk to Jason about this as the level of skill will determine if you use it or not.

Small things that were great adds.. AO Cooler in the closet to bring sandwiches to the mountain, fans in each room, heated mats around hot tub and the front stairs, the digital welcome book that you can save to your phone, and the "If it rots, lets not" motto.

I would go back tomorrow to Breck (mountain was one of our favorites) and stay here again in a heartbeat. We had a blast; wish we could have stayed longer. Thanks Jason for letting us enjoy your house and having everything guests could need while traveling.
reviews/9/response: Wow.. Lori, thank you.    Let's get you back next year for a longer stay.  We ski out and the shuttle runs  for this home until April 19th this year.   April is some of the best powder days.   The summers are fantastic too, we have booked them out 100% for the last 9 years, so please plan ahead for prime dates.  Until then, travel safe.

name: The Outside Inn - amazing views in the heart of CB
reviews/0/comments: The Outside Inn is a comfortable, modern, roomy home located within blocks of the town center of Crested Butte.  It was perfect for our group of thirteen with plenty of common space to enjoy as well as private space for those needing some down time.  The kitchen was well stocked with great appliances, pots, pans, utensils, and dishes. I especially enjoyed the porch where I could sit and enjoy the view of Crested Butte.
reviews/1/comments: This was a great place to stay! We were a group of 10 adults and 7 kids and the house was perfect for us. Great location, clean and well designed house, and Frannki was an outstanding host. She even let us check in early so the kids could take their afternoon nap at the house.
reviews/2/comments: Great house, amenities and location. Felt like we were true locals in this location. Very convenient to everything in CB. Owner very accessible and easy to communicate with throughout our stay.
reviews/3/comments: These are really fine accommodations in a terrific location in Crested Butte. The house provides a wonderful gathering place, inside and outside, for family/friends. Frankki was very responsive to our needs.
reviews/4/comments: Beautiful home in the perfect location. Home has beautiful views, good gathering spaces, clean, and location is only a couple blocks from stores, coffee, park, and other conveniences. Would stay here again and highly recommend.
reviews/5/comments: Such a great Airbnb! Unbeatable location and fantastic setup for large groups. Only a block from town and the shuttle picks you up right across the street. Would highly recommend 👍
reviews/6/comments: We had a group of 16 and the space was perfect. Love how the ski shuttle stops right in front of the house.
reviews/7/comments: This was a great place to stay! The location and number of rooms / beds for 3 families was fantastic. Thank you!
reviews/8/comments: The house had plenty of room for three families to stay. It was convenient to Elk Avenue and skiing since the shuttle drop off/pick up is right across the street. The house had everything we needed and more. I highly recommend it for large groups.
reviews/9/comments: We enjoyed our stay at the home! The location is great for those who want to enjoy the mountain and the downtown area. We did have one minor issue while at the home and the house manager had it fixed quickly.

We do hope that we have another chance in the future to impress you!
reviews/7/comments: Leah and Jason are great hosts. We came back after each day out to a fresh clean place. Great views from Snowmass!

reviews/9/comments: Great layout and nice, clean condo. Owner's are readily available and stay in touch throughout the process. Pretty quiet aside from a little noise from tenants in the condo above us. No A/C, but most nights were nice and cool with the windows open. Overall, a good stay!

reviews/0/comments: Fireplace wasn’t working but everything else was amazing!
reviews/1/comments: Fantastic home.  Learned how to ski in/ski out on the second day...Black Diamond skiers only for ski in portion. We had a thermostat and fire place problem which was fixed with one phone call.  We had an amazing 5 nights.
reviews/2/comments:
This is a truly wonderful home for large groups who want to have a large area where everyone can hang out together... The kitchen is to die for, by the way! Great for socializing while cooking, and fully equipped for almost any meal you can think of...

The rooms are very comfortable, spacious, and all of them have their own bathroom...

The only thing we would have loved is for the weather to have permitted us use the outdoor areas more, but it was snowing or absolutely freezing! These must be absolutely amazing during summer, I guess we will have to be back another time around!
reviews/3/comments: My family and I had an AMAZING stay in Hawks Hideaway for Thanksgiving week.  The house exceeded our expectations.  It was spacious and had room for everyone.  It was clean and no details were spared.  The owners thought about everything and it was executed masterfully. For most of the group, it was the first time we saw snow.  The day before Thanksgiving, it began snowing and all 16 of us were outside playing in the snow and having fun. We had a blast and can't wait to do it again.  Thanks again for making our stay memorable in your home!
reviews/4/comments: This was such a beautiful home. Lots of space but still cozy. Beautiful finishes and large kitchen. Great views and close to town. Loved our stay.
reviews/5/comments: It was amazing honestly, the views of the mountain are spectacular from this property. I would have preferred to be able to lock the the door to the hot tub outside and the door to the fire pit, but other than that everything was perfect. FYI for anyone staying in the property buy altitude sickness pills beforehand  and come super hydrated. Your over 9000 feet up so only for some you can get sick from the high altitude.
reviews/6/comments:
Overall a lovely home! Loved the fireplaces, kitchen, steam shower in the master and the elevator for moving luggage.

We were disappointed to find all of the king size beds to be incredibly firm. Like shockingly firm. We made it for 4 nights but all agreed it would be very uncomfortable to have stayed longer.
Odd that so few kitchen towels and paper products were supplied. Not a huge issue but at this price level and size of home, it was a noticed inconvenience.

The layout is great for a group of friends or family with most rooms having an amazing view.
reviews/7/comments: great house and location
reviews/8/comments: This was such a beautiful home. Everything was modern but had a natural, elegant feel to it. We had three families with young kids - the kids piled into the loft with bunk beds and had a BLAST. They really had a nice time to bond in a fun atmosphere- downtown Breckenridge was very close and convenient. Everything was clean and beautifully maintained. If we come back to the area this is where we will stay! The hosts were extremely helpful when needed. Overall a wonderful experience!
reviews/9/comments: This house could not be better. The location is perfect, with some of the best views while also being super close to downtown -- but also, the house itself is amazing. It's incredibly spacious,  has great amenities (tempurpedic beds, wolf appliances,  beautiful fireplaces, wine fridges, Golden Tee (this got A LOT of use), etc.), and just an overall great layout/setup for families/friends. Definitely will be coming back!

reviews/0/comments: Beautiful location, received great customer service from Clint!
reviews/1/comments: This condo was spacious with beautiful views & centrally located to access all the town has to offer.  We cooked most meals at home without any issues as basic kitchenware was provided.  We enjoyed the cozy living room & deck table/chairs to relax & take in the views.
reviews/2/comments: The views and location are excellent! We spent pretty much the entire time out on the patio, taking in the amazing, uninterrupted mountain views. It’s near town and a nice bike trail. The size of the space is perfect for four people, we were comfortable in the living room together and brought chair on the patio so we could all sit together. The furniture and bedding in the bedrooms feels particularly dated, but we were all happy and comfortable. Overall, this place is an excellent value for the location and views! Great, quick communication with Bighorn Rentals, too!
reviews/3/comments: Great value, with Frisco being a short drive to all the ski resorts.
reviews/4/comments: This is a very nice place overall, with great furniture, a nice view out the back, and a good location for getting to a variety of places in the mountains nearby.  If you plan on cooking, just know that the knives are too dull to work with and the pans are warped enough to make them hard to use.  We were pleasantly surprised to find cooking oil and other small things available around the kitchen.  The covered parking spot is worth having - especially in the winter snow.  Check-in is easy, but know that communication through AirBNB was not very good, while it was through email with the rental company.  Their fine print is long, but nothing seemed unreasonable.  Would stay again.

name: Amazing Mountain Home w/ 360 degree mountain views

The beds were really comfy, and the view from the hot tub and balcony at the back was amazing! The host was very responsive to any questions that I had. I would 100% stay here again and recommend this house to anyone else!

really beautiful property. we spent most of the time in the house due all the snow so we didn't experience the town or resort much.

nice big house with a great kitchen.

The views from the balcony were exceptional, especially sunsets.  The two living areas were perfect for kids to have space to themselves for games, TV, etc.   The  photos don’t do this place justice.  Matt was easy to communicate with, as was Mark, who lives in CB.  Very highly recommend!
reviews/4/comments: The house is incredible.  Great space, we had 3 families and 7 kids and had plenty of room.  An incredible view of the town and of sunsets.  Matt is an incredible host and was very quick with responses and very accommodating.  The most stocked house I have stayed in!!  They had everything like your own home.  Quick trip to the slopes.  Incredible house.
reviews/5/comments:
If you have a large group looking for an incredible house in Crested Butte, this is the home for you! Our entire group loved this home and had plenty of space for each of us. The hot tub, heated floors, Sonos speakers, heated garage, and location to both the mountain & town could not of been any better. The views out the back deck are literally perfect. The owner's timely responses to any question we had, was also very appreciated.

Everything was perfect and being able to stay at this house truly made our entire trip. If you are debating between this home and another... take this one.

name: Beautifully remodeled 3 bedroom/2.5 bath condo in
reviews/0/comments: Great location right at the base of Copper Mountain with a beautiful view. Apartment was clean, warm & conveniently located about a 10 min drive from Frisco & close to other mountains as well.
reviews/1/comments:
The condo was nicely appointed with good beds in each room. Kitchen was well stocked with most items you need to cook with. Location to lift was good but a little further than some Center village locations. It was our first time staying on the east side. View was excellent and probably the best we have had. All bedrooms have view of slopes as well as living room and balcony. The only drawback to the unit itself was seating in living room. It only has the one sofa. Plenty of bar stools to sit on but not comfortable enough to watch TV for any length of time.
The complex itself is nice and well kept. The only drawback to complex and facing slope side is it is located directly on the road where the buses drop off everyone and they run constantly also the snowplow comes through at about 6am and for light sleepers it will wake you. At night it is very quiet and peaceful. All in all it is a nice place to stay for a week of skiing.
reviews/2/comments: This place had the best location and view at Copper Mountain. We will definitely stay here again!

name: Villas ~ Unit 1523 ~ Snowmass Club Access

reviews/1/comments: Great condo, well located near Two Creeks for easy access to the slopes.  If you want to ski Snowmass, this is a great option! Easily sleeps 6 with the pull out sofa, comfortable and quiet for a great getaway!
reviews/1/response: Hi Steve, I am glad to that your stay went so well. I hope you come back soon or next winter season!

Our stay at the home in Snowmass was truly perfect.
The house was incredibly spacious--plenty of room for our large group to enjoy the kitchen and main living area. The bedrooms were perfect for a large group of multiple families or a large couples trip. We loved the bedding and all of the finishes in the bedrooms. Everything was exceptionally clean and really looked brand new. The place clearly has a beautiful new renovation with new appliances and easy to use technology throughout. The wood fire place in the main living area was great after the slopes. We loved that they finished out the (heated) garage with a game room including ping-pong and darts, and the hot tub worked great and was well-maintained.

The location is ideal. Very close to snowmass village--can hike up the road to ski-in-ski out or a quick 2 minute ride with the included dial-a-ride for super easy pick-ups and drop-offs. Taxis/ubers were readily available into the village or to Aspen later at night as well.

Really we couldn't have asked for a better setup for our yearly ski-trip. A couple of us are even planning to head back this spring and use the same place! I should also mention David is a great communicator and made all of our coordination seamless.
reviews/5/comments: This place is absolutely gorgeous. Wonderful views from basically every room. David, the host, was great to deal with. Highly recommended!

name: Top Floor Unit That Overlooks Ten Mile Creek - RG3
reviews/0/comments: Will work with Bighorn rentals anytime.  They made the process easy.  Thanks to all.
reviews/1/comments: Great location, everything was clean
reviews/2/comments: Highly recommended
reviews/3/comments: amazing location. Its on the 3rd floor of the brown building. parking is a little inconvenient. PS they dont allow trailers to be parked inside one of your parking spots so if you have a trailer your hauling speak with management.
reviews/4/comments: Clean, light filled, nicely appointed condo! Kids loved the loft beds and it easily slept the five of us. Just one block off of Main Street so it made dining out and shopping easy.
reviews/5/comments:
Comfortable, specious and clean. We really enjoyed our stay here. Kitchen was fully equipped and we loved making a couple meals there. FYI - the place is on the 3rd floor so be prepared to lug your luggage. We had ski gear and that was not fun.
The main bedroom shower is poorly designed. When you take a shower lots of water ends up on the floor - could have given us a few extra towels. Otherwise place was great and we would come back with lighter suitcases.
reviews/6/comments: An excellent place to stay central to ski resorts. Quiet location. Fully stocked kitchen, bath (plenty of towels!!) Made for a great vacation. Easy walk to shops. Responsive management. Exceeded expectations.
reviews/7/comments: Beautiful condo, very clean,  amenities as expected, great location. We had a great trip thank you for opening your home.
reviews/8/comments: Lovely place. Came stocked with firewood.
reviews/9/comments: This was an unexpected last minute booking for us and under some stressful circumstances. The quick response time and fantastic accommodations saved the day!

name: Breck Escape
reviews/0/comments: We can't say enough good things about Breck Escape! My team and I thoroughly enjoyed the home. Another review said that what you see in the pictures is a true depiction of the home and that is so true. It's beautiful and the views from the back of the house are probably the best in the neighborhood. This home was built with such care and it shows in every inch of square footage. The customer service when I texted for questions or help was exactly as it should be and I couldn't be more thankful. This was a beautiful stay and I would give 10 stars if I could. We ran into the cleaners as we were leaving and I had to thank them for how clean it was when we arrived. It's clean, airy and the high ceilings make for an even larger feel in the already large space. It's under 10 minutes to Main St. and anything else you may need while there, for those worried about proximity to town. I am saving this property for my next visit to Breck! Thank you to the owners for offering such a lovely spot to the public!
reviews/1/comments:
Great place! Plenty of space for any large groups/ families

Very clean & close to everything

Trail right behind the house

Views… incredible!!!
reviews/2/comments: We have a family vacation every year and Breckinridge was fabulous!  Great hiking, rafting, shopping and food! We had adults, teenagers and an 15 month old.  Home was spacious and had great views! Would recommend home and Breckinridge!
reviews/3/comments: We had an incredible experience staying here. The home and location was incredible!
reviews/4/comments: This house is spectacular!..both the house itself and the location+outlook. It comfortably accommodates large groups and is great for entertaining. Communication and check-in/out was excellent. Recommend having a car(s) as the shuttle isn’t accessible, but the location is a short, easy drive (or Uber at night) to the slopes and town. Would definitely stay again!
reviews/5/comments: We had a great family vacation in Breckenridge. The house, Breck Escape, was beautiful!! Great furnishings, plenty of beds for everyone. Kitchen had everything we needed and more. The back of the house was all windows and had a great view of the mountains. The deck was along these windows and went the full length of the house. With 10 adults there, we had plenty of room. We all said we would come back to this house (Website hidden by Airbnb) was that good!
reviews/6/comments: Everything was great. The property management was helpful and gave us zero issues. Everyone had their own private space to retreat to. Really close to Main Street. So glad we chose this home for our trip.
reviews/7/comments: the house was great. kitchen well stocked. Appliances are good quality. Views are amazing. Tastefully furnished. Internet was good too. i would repeat and recommend
reviews/8/comments:
The house and management company (Pinnacle Lodging) are absolutely amazing! But there is a neighbor to be cautioned about. This neighbor called into the housing community's "complaint hotline" at 10:30PM with false accusations stating cars were "blocking the road". Pinnacle Lodging was on top of it and gave me a call at 11:00PM to inform me of the complaint. We arrived at the house around 9:00PM and did not touch our vehicles till the next day. There were no cars to be seen on or near the road and it was obvious a neighbor was trying to cause issues.

In short, the house and Pinnacle lodging were fantastic and better than expected, but this disturbed neighbor making false complaints at 10:30PM left a very bad taste in my mouth.

name: Ski-in/Ski-out Condo! Top of the Village!
reviews/0/comments: Wow!  Location location location!  This condo is absolutely wonderful. It is truly a ski in/ski out property. reviews/1/comments: Outstanding location!  Truly ski-in/ski-out with everything you need to have a wonderful vacation.  Exceeded my expectations and I definitely recommend and/or would stay again!

The unit is clean, comfortable, and cozy.  Parking is just a few feet away.  The internet worked very well, and our stay there was perfect!

name: 4 BEDROOM 4 BATH HOME PARK AVE. ASPEN!

reviews/0/comments:
There's an old saying that says you get what you pay for. This one of the best Airbnb's I've ever stayed in
Very well appointed the kitchen was amazing and had every appliance you could ask for. The living areas were absolutely like staying in somebody's home. A lot of Airbnb's are not as good and they're just investments for people thinking they can make money by providing basically a building with nothing in it this was not the case in Snowmass a such a nice home that you couldn't help but looking after it each and every day as if it was yours as if you were a guest in somebody else's home truly an amazing facility. Beautiful picture windows looking at that beautiful aspen trees the views off in the distance of the mountains and the wildlife that would come and check out the house at night really wonderful the showers wort the water was cold or hot whichever you wanted the pool was amazing the Jacuzzi worked wonderfully. If you're looking for a world-class facility that you could put anybody in whether it was a Rock Star or visiting Dignitary. This is absolutely probably one of the best places I've ever stayed in certainly on par with my own home. Really a great experience.

reviews/0/comments: There’s no such thing as Valery. That’s a catfish. I booked it in May but was not sure it was available till 30 days before check-in. I contacted multiple times for a month Airbnb was very helpful whoever this other company is felt really sketchy. The company asked me to cancel with Airbnb and go straight through with them so they didn’t have to pay the commission. I contacted Airbnb and they said I’d lose my money but more importantly my family vacation would’ve been ruined because there were no more places for the New Year’s holiday in Aspen. That was a sweet girl he got on the phone and offered to call every day but the guy who ownsThe condo in London drug his feet but I finally got it and my experience at the Saint Regis in Aspen was fabulous.
reviews/0/response: Valerie is alive and well...and I'm right here.  Call our office and you can speak with me or one of our travel agents.  The guest booked directly on our Airbnb and called for a discount to avoid paying Airbnb charges after he learned of our lower price.  We declined to cancel it.  Nevertheless, Our concierge Camilla spent hours helping him with this trip "the sweet girl he mentions".  Camilla did an extraordinary job and we are very proud of her and the services we provided including RT limo transfers, restaurant reservation, ski rentals, lift tickets, ski rental delviery and more.  We pride ourselves on 5-star service but we realize some people are harder to please than others.  Have a blessed day.

name: Downtown Aspen
reviews/0/comments: Great experience all around!
reviews/1/comments:
The house was in a great location and well set up, however there were numerous communication and maintenance issues that went unsolved.

We were working remotely from Aspen for 3 weeks, and the internet didn't work (i.e. calls would be dropped, Netflix wouldn't load). When we told Nina about the issue she said "it's working fine" (without actually inspecting it). When the tech finally came, he confirmed the router was busted, but only fixed it the day we left. For such an expensive house, I'd expect basic things to be working, and, more importantly, for the owner to fix them when we notify. It was hard to work remotely without functioning internet.

Other similar communication and maintenance issues:
1. When we arrived, the garage code to enter didn't work, and the owner's response was "I'm surfing, try to figure it out"
2. The garage code for access frequently stopped working and we needed to coordinate almost daily maintenance visits
3. The bathtub stopped working, was "fixed", and then stopped working shortly after

The above issues are OK, the primary issue was the response to every maintenance request was "you're lying, it's working properly", followed by someone coming to "fix it", followed by it breaking again shortly after. For this price, I'd expect better service/maintenance/communication.

The house itself was great and location is excellent.

reviews/3/response:
We're happy to hear that you enjoyed the location and views. The condo doesn't have AC however there is a box fan in the closet. We also have plenty of fans in our office, we would have delivered one if we would have known you were in need. One of the great things about staying with a property management company is that we have staff that will deliver anything you need to make your stay more comfortable.

We're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy the open concept in the master bedroom. Should your travels bring you back to Snowmass Village- don't hesitate to reach out prior to booking, we'll help you book the perfect place.
reviews/4/comments: My friends and I stayed here on a ski trip and would 100% recommend. The location is great! Only 5 minutes away from Snowmass ski resort. reviews/4/response: Thank you for choosing Snowmass Vacations, we're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay & appreciatet that you recommend us to others!
reviews/5/comments: Solid place in Snowmass. Good location with bus stop right outside the home, and a five minute ride to the base of the mountain. The twin beds were a bit small for me (6'2"). And the rate was economical.
reviews/5/response: We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay.

reviews/0/comments: Breathtaking views! Stacey and team were quick to respond and worked through all of our needs.

name: Gorgeous mountain mansion with amazing views & pool table- close to the slopes
reviews/0/comments: Beautiful property with a phenomenal view
reviews/1/comments: Amazing home with excellent views of the mountains. Owners’ pride of ownership is displayed throughout with  art pieces that fit the theme.
reviews/2/comments:
I want to start off by saying that this home has incredible views, great layout, and is cool for a large group. But… For starters, they gave us the wrong code to get into the house , the main garage door was broken and not functional (this was not mentioned to us prior) and we had to spend 20 minutes figuring this out on our own in 20 degree weather. After being in the freezing cold, our group had all gone to take showers only to realize there was NO Hot water. Although they had someone come out to try and fix this issue, we had no hot water our first night in the middle of winter.

Once we were able to get inside, we noticed that there were quite a few things that were missing that had been advertised and were core reasons that we rented this home to begin with.

To list a few… No outdoor furniture and Fire Pit, no access to the balconies in the bedrooms that were stamped with a “this door is not for use and will not open sign” (in all bedrooms), the master was presented with a jacuzzi tub which was not to be used as well. Also, they were missing basic necessities like a hair dryers and salt and pepper.. it is the little things that make your experience.

This review is not intended to bash this home, but when spending the high premium in which we did to rent this house, we had expected what we had paid for. If i have any suggestions, they would be to properly advertise the property accordingly and show images of what you are actually getting.. also maybe a new property management company, although Marjorie was very nice.
reviews/3/comments: Beautiful house with amazing views! Manager super nice and responds quickly.
reviews/4/comments: Amazing!
reviews/5/comments: Beautiful home and view. Loved every minute of staying here. We were there for my son’s wedding and everyone was very impressed.
reviews/6/comments:
