reviews/8/comments: A truly enjoyable and reasonably priced stay in such a beautiful location. The fireplace and massage chair made it that much more magical!
reviews/9/comments: This place looks just like the pictures.

name: The Red Door Hideout - Historic D/T Cabin
reviews/0/comments: Great place to stay when in Carbondale.  Short walk to everything. The wellness place across the street is a nice bonus. Terrific host.
reviews/0/response: Marty, we're so glad you were able to check out the True Nature Healing Arts Center! We think it's a great addition to the area, and what makes it even better is, it's just steps from the front door!
reviews/1/comments: The stay was very nice and host had excellent communication.
reviews/1/response: Thank you for staying, Tyler! We hope you will visit us again in the future.
reviews/2/comments: Awesome stay in a great location. Would highly recommend.
reviews/2/response: Thank you so much for the recommendation, Nikhil! It was a pleasure to host you.
reviews/3/comments: Great location. Great stay. Unique. Fun
reviews/3/response: Thank you for the review, David! We hope you will visit Carbondale again and we would love to host you in the future.
reviews/4/comments: Location was perfect!
reviews/4/response: Hi Haley, We have to agree that the location is perfect! Thank you for staying with us, we hope to host you again!
reviews/5/comments: The cabin was cute and clean. Perfect for two people and the location is for the most part great. It's a little too close to the back door of a restaurant and during the night you hear all the noise you'd expect from a busy restaurant kitchen. It's really noisy and normally this wouldn't bother me but the first night we arrived we decided to go to bed earlier than usual around 10:30 since we just wanted to sleep and rest from the long trip and we couldn't do that with all the noise going on. Not sure what time the restaurant closes but the noise kept jolting me awake until about midnight. I know this isn't something that can be controlled by the host but it did take a little bit from an otherwise great experience. Everything with the cabin itself was great though, and it has a lot of history which is a definite plus!
reviews/5/response: Hi Karen! Thank you so much for coming to stay with us. We’re so sorry that you ran into noise issues during your stay. This is usually not a problem, but understandably, we are in a downtown setting so there can be that hustle and bustle sometimes. We’re glad to hear that everything else was great for your visit though!
reviews/6/comments: Cozy, clean with all the necessary amenities!  Close to everything!!
reviews/6/response: We really enjoyed hosting you, Jason! You are always welcome back at the Red Door Hideout!
reviews/7/comments: Beautiful place, and the hosts were very nice people. That area is amazing, you’ll love your stay.
reviews/7/response: It was wonderful to host you, Darie! Thank you for visiting!
reviews/8/comments: Perfect location! The cabin is perfect for two people! Host was amazing, highly recommend!
reviews/8/response: It was a pleasure to host you, Jack! Thank you for coming.
reviews/9/comments: It’s a really awesome place to stay! So clean and has a lot of history!! It’s also right downtown, so it’s near all the shops and restaurants.
reviews/9/response: We really enjoyed hosting you, Haley!  Thank you for visiting!

name: Cabin << in the woods >>
reviews/0/comments: Loved staying here and would love to come back soon!! it’s a beautiful cabin. I loved the aesthetic and effort that went into creating such a beautiful space. I saw a few deer close by  and the huskies are so sweet. Favorite part was definitely the outdoor shower with the sunrise. Patrick was very helpful with suggesting hikes— beautiful one not too far from the home. Thank you!!!
reviews/1/comments: Don't go if you're afraid of heights, but definitely go if you're in need of adventure! I went with my bestfriend and we had so much fun. Very close proximity to downtown Aspen, as well! Patrick was very helpful.
reviews/2/comments: Great getaway in the woods!
reviews/3/comments: Great spot for glamping! A great alternative to the ritzy and expensive spots in Aspen while being only a 15 min drive away. Bed was cozy and was secluded yet close to the main house where we felt safe. Great spot. Amazing views.
reviews/4/comments: Patrick and Nicole were amazing! Lovely people, the stay was amazing and I have no complaints. Definitely THE place to stay if you are planning a trip around Aspen.
reviews/5/comments: I came within several feet of a deer feeding on bushes right next to The Hut with my morning coffee. It was a great place to relax. :)
reviews/6/comments: Patrick and Nicole were great hosts. The cabin is in a great location, just 15min to Aspen ski resorts. You can expect a rustic experience, which adds to the charm :)
reviews/7/comments:
Very special place.
The owners are very nice.
If you want to be close to Aspen and Snowmass and want to have a special experience, this is the place.
Marc V, Montreal
reviews/8/comments: A fantastic cabin the woods! A wonderful winter getaway that was a very short dive from the park and ride to all the resorts
reviews/9/comments: Such a neat cabin stay with small details that show the love and effort put into it. The bed was so cozy and the heated mattress pad was the cherry on top. Patrick's hospitality was by far the best I've had at a stay. Extremely communicative, accommodating, and very helpful with local recommendations! The views and location also can't be beat. I'd love to come back and would recommend the stay to anyone!

name:
Crystal River Casita
A Mountain Hideaway
reviews/0/comments: Loved my stay here! Elias & Misty had great/fast communication and let me check in early, which was appreciated. I’ll definitely stay again when I’m in the area!
reviews/1/comments: What a great location to spend a few days in the area.   It is so peaceful, and if you sleep with the window open, the river can lull you to sleep.  We came with our dog, and she thought it was pretty cool to be able to walk to the river in the morning.   We also enjoyed the occasional visit by their dog Zephyr.   One thing to note, if your dog needs to go out and potty at 2am, take a good headlamp and/or flashlight, it is very dark!
reviews/2/comments: Peaceful and invigorating. A great spot to launch into exploration of the area.
reviews/3/comments: We had a wonderful stay here! The neighborhood was very quiet and perfect for taking our dog for walks. The house was well equipped with everything we needed! The bed was extremely comfortable. Less than a 10 minute drive to downtown Carbondale!
reviews/4/comments: Cute cabin in a beautiful location. Hosts were wonderful. Super nice and quick to respond. Highly recommend!
reviews/5/comments:
The cabin was the perfect size for us. We appreciate the anniversary welcome. The cabin was well stocked and clean. The location was great with beautiful views. The sound of the river was calming.

Elias and Misty were great hosts. We hope to stay at the cabin again in the future. We will also recommend the cabin to other people.
reviews/6/comments: Comfortable, clean lovely view off of the deck. Great game selection. And I won at Uno :-)
reviews/7/comments: Fantastic base camp for activities near Carbondale. The house was very clean and comfortable, and you can't beat falling asleep to the Crystal River at night.
reviews/8/comments: This cabin is in a lovely spot, where you can fall asleep to the sound of the river. The kitchen is well stocked, and it even has washer and dryer for post-hike clean up. Elias and Misty were perfect hosts and made us feel as welcome as family.
reviews/9/comments: Great place...perfect description from host.  Beautiful mountains fresh air!  Well stocked kitchen and comfortable bed.

name: 🌲Hot Tub~Pool~WiFi~Ski-in/out~Local Shuttle~Timberline Studio, Standard~Unit 118🌲
reviews/0/comments: Our stay was great. Management was good to work with when a major issue came up with our car, and we appreciated their assistance.  The beautiful jacuzzi was a delight, and a free concert down the hill within walking distance was an unexpected plus!
reviews/1/comments: Great location. Great amenities too! Already booked to come back for ski season. We had one of the ground floor units which is even better because it’s ski in and ski out! Lots of ample parking but overall just a quick drive to Downtown Aspen but also has great public transportation between Aspen proper and snow mass. This is a hidden gem in terms of stays.
reviews/2/comments: Great accommodations for the price point with a very friendly and helpful staff!!!

name: The Bear Den | Stunning Lake + Alpine Lookouts | Starlink Wifi
reviews/0/comments: We had a great stay, loved the location and the unit. We would highly recommend staying here!
reviews/1/comments: This was a perfect spot for our Colorado trip. We did quite a bit of traveling so only stayed for a few days. We certainly could have stayed longer as there was plenty in the area for us to do. The cabin had all the necessary items  to make our stay comfortable and to cook meals. A peaceful retreat! Great communication and information provided from host.
reviews/2/comments: An excellent cabin settled just above twin lakes. It was super clean, modern and very pet friendly. Communication with hosts was clear and efficient. Highly recommend you stay here on your next mountain adventure.
reviews/2/response: Thank you so much for the ★★★★★ review, Kaitlin! Looking forward to hosting you again!
reviews/3/comments: The checking in and out process was simple and easy. Host was always quick to respond. The cabin was cozy and clean and had everything I needed and then some. The parking was right by the cabin and there was plenty of space for our vehicles. Next time I stay I'll probably pick one of their cabins at the front with a view of the lake as this cabin was more towards the back. I enjoyed my stay and look forward to my next visit back!
reviews/4/comments: Awesome location literally above Twin Lakes.  Totally cute cabin.
reviews/5/comments: This cabin was great! Awesome location, clean and had everything we needed for a weekend stay. Check in/out was easy and communication was fast and simple. Would rent again if we are back in the Twin Lakes area!
reviews/6/comments: Beautiful location near Twin Lakes and lots of gorgeous views! House was clean and spacious, comfortable bed and the check-in/check-out process was easy!
reviews/7/comments: The cabin is simple and has cute bear and moose decorations.  It is behind some other cabins, so you must move up in front of those for a view.  It is comfortable and the management does a good job of communicating with guests and seeing if they need anything.  It is close to fishing and hiking areas and easily accessible.
reviews/8/comments: Gorgeous view and cozy space! If you’re in twin lakes area this is the place to stay!!
reviews/9/comments: The Bear Den is a very cute cabin, very clean, well equipped and nicely decorated.  The king bed was too hard for me and I was happy to have another choice in the 2nd bedroom.  We enjoyed how close we were to the lakes and all the fantastic hiking!

name: Sunlight Mountain Getaway - White River
reviews/0/comments: This place is dilapidated and quirky (don't stop reading here). But it also grew on us after experiencing the outdoor space, how dog-friendly it was, and open access to all of the amenities of a previously-functioning lodge. The vibe was good, the people were lovely. And we will go back.
reviews/1/comments: Excellent
reviews/2/comments: Very nice
reviews/3/comments: We wanted to stay near Iron Mountain hot springs without renting one of the dime-a-dozen motels in the area. We loved the old Western vibe and history of the area and this place fit right in. The inn is clean and organized, the large kitchen was perfect for making breakfast.  The only downside was that the rooms had thin walls so people coming down the hall are clearly audible if you're an early sleeper, like I am.
reviews/4/comments:
Overall I enjoyed my stay, wish I had more time.
Thank you
reviews/5/comments: Not your typical hotel . Host very accommodating for early check-in . Beautiful property. But.. Not your regular hotel . walls very thin . Rooms older . More hostel-ish . But if your fine with that then perfect place to be . noise til late at night . Had to be up and on the road at 5 am so between the thin walls and Happy people Only got 2 hours of sleep . Fell asleep driving for a sec the next day . Not cool
reviews/6/comments: It was a great place to stay. Nice and clean. The location was nice. Very quite and peaceful. Worth the price. Altai was great communicating  about everything and making it easy for us.
reviews/7/comments: Fantastic location at the base of Sunlight Mtn. The lodge is not staffed, but everything needed was supplied. Access to the kitchen was very welcome! The game room/bar and the patio are great places to relax.
reviews/8/comments: The views!! Omg! Beautiful. This was a great stay. Rooms are on the smaller side which didn't bother us as we spent time in several of the other gathering areas during our stay. Pool table, games galore, breakfast foods in the fridge that we could cook ourselves. Mattresses are updated and cozy. Pillows could use an update. Nothing fancy here - but clean and cozy. Porch is rickety in areas but they have cones marking it. Great hikes (we visited late June), beautiful views. First night was quiet. Second night there was more activity from guests in the hallways and other rooms - turn on the fan or bring your earplugs.  I had a last minute change to add a second person and a dog to the reservation and it was no issue at all. Top notch communication from staff before, during, and after our stay. Would definitely visit again!! ❤️⭐️👍🏽
reviews/8/response: Glad you enjoyed your stay.  Take care Julie
reviews/9/comments: Very informative, great communication, clean and a nice experience with the community!

name: 7 Dog Friendly Private Room in Downtown Leadville
reviews/0/comments: The place was exactly what I expected and more. No complaints.
reviews/1/comments: Great place to stay in Downtown Leadville. Super Cozy!
reviews/2/comments: Great place to stay in Leadville. The room was very clean and Ting included the most thoughtful touches!
reviews/3/comments: Amazing as always - I can’t say enough about Ting and the hospitality.  I keep coming back!
reviews/4/comments: Walkable location, cozy room, nice little touches like a French press and a goody bag with sunscreen, chap stick, and snacks. Only thing to note is there is no air conditioning, only heat - which honestly was not a problem at all because we just opened up the window to let the cool night breeze in :) this was my second time here at Mountain Peaks and I will be back!
reviews/5/comments: Mountain Peaks was awesome! Perfect location in Leadville. Very walkable to the downtown area. It felt safe as well. The inside was small but the space was utilized perfectly. The owner provides everything you need for your stay. There was plenty of hot water and the pressure was good. The bed was really comfy! Theres a little road noise at times but overall a peaceful place. I really appreciated the little welcome treats they left for us and our dog. Can’t speak enough about this place. Definitely book it! :)
reviews/6/comments: Everything was excellent and quite sufficient for my 2 night stay.  I came to climb Mt Elbert- the highest peak in Colorado and had a great time. Bathroom/shower were very nice.  Everything was very clean when I walked in.  Wi-Fi works very well.  Everything was positive.  The owners replied quickly if I had a question.
reviews/7/comments: Everything you need and nothing you don't! Simple and very clean rooms with very good tea and French press coffee, very comfortable bed!
reviews/8/comments: Great location with easy access to downtown.
reviews/9/comments: Loved our stay here! Ting was so great about communication, and even let us check in early due to weather issues. Upon arrival, there was a handwritten note, a human goody bag, and a dog goody bag for our pup! Loved the stocked fridge. Great location as well! I also recommend checking out the UTV tours next door - they’re so fun!

name: Heart of Carbondale
reviews/0/comments: very clean, easy check in and check out, great place to stay.
reviews/1/comments: Great location, comfortable beds and clean space. You enter the basement through the garage and parking is very wonky but served it's purpose for a quick stay.
reviews/2/comments: Brooke's and David's home was beautiful and in a great location. The space was very clean and organized. It was very easy for us to walk downtown and enjoy breakfast, drinks and dinner. We asked for some towels last minute to head to Penny Hot Springs and Brooke kindly made them available to us. Definitely would recommend their home.
reviews/3/comments: Brooke and David had great communication and were flexible with our needs.
reviews/4/comments: The room was nice and clean and Brooke and David are nice and hassle free to work with.
reviews/5/comments: Great location, walking distance to everything!
reviews/6/comments: Great location! The place was clean, communication was great, and the description accurate. A quick walk to town and a quick drive or bike ride to beautiful rivers, trails, and hot springs.
reviews/7/comments: Great location.
reviews/8/comments: Lovely stay, super close to the main part of town!
reviews/9/comments: Exactly what listing says, clean and great place to rest your head. The shower water was wonderfully warm.

name: 🌲Hot Tub~Pool~WiFi~Ski-in/out~Local Shuttle~ Timberline Studio, Deluxe~Unit 116🌲
reviews/0/comments: J at the front desk is amazing and makes your stay very Comfy!!  If you’re looking for a place to stay while having a summer adventure, this is it!

name: Sunlight Mountain Getaway - Tercero
reviews/0/comments: Great place to stay, nice and cozy! Will be back again.
reviews/1/comments:
If you're looking to find some peace and serenity in a remote mountain location outside of the busyness of Glenwood Springs, then your search is officially over!

Your host Altai is wonderful and responsive to needs/requests that you might have, while his staff is equally helpful and friendly.

Our only regret is that we did not book to stay longer than 3 days and 2 nights, but we will definitely be back when looking to stay in this area again......
reviews/2/comments: When I pulled up to the place I was shocked how run down, not at all maintained it was inside and outside. Inside the room was okay. I could not open the window to get some fresh air in, thank goodness there was a fan there but it just moved around the hot air. No a/c. I had a medical procedure that I was under anesthesia that I had to come back to and it was very uncomfortable being in the room so I stayed outside on the deck where there was fresh, cool air until I went to bed. The bed was actually very comfortable and it was clean inside the room. Because of being on anesthesia I was ultra-sensitive to the cleaning chemicals in the whole place, especially the room. I knew going into this that it was a rustic place but this gives a whole new meaning to rustic and not in a good way!!
reviews/3/comments: Room was small but clean and down homey. Rustic may be a good term.  Would stay again for sure
reviews/4/comments: Nice place for the adventure bug
reviews/5/comments: Cannot say enough good things about this spot- the lodge is cozy, the people are friendly and respectful, and the location is beautiful! Equidistant to Glenwood Springs and Carbondale, this is an excellent home base for hiking, biking, and exploring the area. The lodge has everything you’ll need- a full kitchen with the essentials, a grill, a volley ball court (!!), a large ice machine, tons of board games, cozy reading nooks with relaxing views of the creek running through the back yard, and if you’re there in the winter you’ll be a 5 minute walk from the Sunlight ski lift. Altai is a welcoming and responsive host, and has created a really lovely place to stay.
reviews/5/response: Thanks Kate, appreciate the feedback.   cheers :)
reviews/6/comments: This place is awesome. So beautiful on the outside, and the inside is totally unique. Very cabin-y feel, quiet and serene.
reviews/6/response: Thanks for the review Amanda.  Cheers :)
reviews/7/comments: A truly special place! Such a cool space and an Air bnb like no other.
reviews/7/response: Thanks Madeline, glad you enjoyed your time.  :)
reviews/8/comments: This place is situated in a beautiful location and has a homey vibe with a kind and responsive host. Be advised there is no A/C, but the room did come with a box fan. The open window provided enough air circulation, but unfortunately there was not a screen to prevent insects or critters from entering. The shower was not clean (black mold) and the light above the bathroom sink turned on but did not contribute any luminescence to the space. The room was only secured by a single doorknob with key, no deadbolt. With a few upgrades to safety and cleanliness, this place could be great.
reviews/8/response: Thanks for feedback, we have some work to do for continuous improvements.  Take care
reviews/9/comments: This place has an amazing view!

name: Quaint Queen Mountain Getaway
reviews/0/comments: Super clean place, beautifully located, and the bed was extremely comfortable - a great reprieve at the end of long days of hiking and enjoying one of Colorado's most beautiful areas!
reviews/1/comments: Very comfortable and clean condo.  Nice corner unit and completely updated and new!  I will stay again at Nicole's condos in Crystal Villas.  The location can't be beat!
reviews/2/comments: We enjoyed our stay in Redstone. It’s a great location on the main stretch and is within walking distance of the shops and general store. The condo was clean and check-in was easy.
reviews/3/comments: Nicole was an excellent host and extremely responsive when communicating with us. This unit is small, but we found it cozy and just what we were looking for during a quiet getaway for the two of us. Everything we needed was furnished, even ideas for local outings. We’ll be back!
reviews/4/comments: I wanted to explore some new areas during my recent vacation in Colorado and Redstone, along with the surrounding area did not disappoint. To begin, Nicole's place is conveniently located to everything I hoped to see and do: hiking, fishing, natural hot springs, the majestic beauty of the river, and of course the areas history. In addition, after a long day of all those activities, the bed and pillows were SO COMFORTABLE! Nicole's place was perfect for a "stay and play" or "go and explore." The Redstone Art Gallery is a must.  For some reason, I couldn't access my reservation and needed to call Nicole. She was very helpful and so kind.
reviews/5/comments:
The place itself was clean, it was small and cozy. The only thing was that the unit didn’t have A/C which wasn’t listed on the description when booking it. We were expecting it to be more of a its own place and not more of an apt unit where there other guest also staying.
The neighbor unit had guests and they had children which were up by 5-6AM with a lot of noice and it was kind of a turndown.
Otherwise, Nicole was a great host.
reviews/6/comments: Absolutely would stay here again!  If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, quiet get away in a stunning location, look no further.  The property backs right up to the Crystal River complete with comfortable outdoor furnishings.  Every evening we used the charcoal grill to make dinner on the river.  Redstone has a charming General Store with some, but very limited, local produce and meat/cheese. Everyone is extremely friendly and the scenery cannot be beat!  If you need a little more excitement or dinning choices (we did not), Carbondale is a quick drive down 133 along the river.  This place is within walking distance to all things Redstone.  We brought our bikes, stayed 3 nights, and drove the car once.
reviews/7/comments: This is a great place for exploring Redstone and environs. It's a corner unit, so you can have some welcome cross ventilation on a hot day when you open the windows, and it's so relaxing to hear the river as you lie in bed. Redstone is a quiet, peaceful place and you can spend a lovely afternoon visiting the antique/gift/art shops. Some seem to be open only on weekends, so be advised. If you're a hiker, I recommend the East Creek Trail, accessible at the north end of town. You don't even have to go too far up the trail to get some great views. I loved sitting in the back yard of the rental, eating delicious pizza from Propaganda Pie, right next to the river. The food at the General Store is also excellent and the women who work there are delightful. I'll be back!
reviews/8/comments: Very nice. Great location. Lots of hot water for great showers.
reviews/9/comments: This place is great. Such a nice little town, you won't want to leave. The rooms and kitchen are spotlessly clean with all the essentials.  I opened the windows at night and closed them in the morning for a nice cool room in the afternoon.  I've stayed here many times over the last 15 years and will do so again I'm sure. Thank you Nicole!

name: Lakeside Master Suite with Private Entrance
reviews/0/comments: Great location, very private with own separate entrance, lovely host family. Would love to stay again in the future!!
reviews/1/comments:
I enjoyed my stay in Basalt!
However after camping 4 nights in the woods I was really looking forward to wash my face first with a small washcloth, not a hand towel! I messaged host and next evening she gave me a second towel! A basic ítem in any bathroom, I think it would be really nice to be provided with two wash clothes in any lodging place around Aspen area! Also there were dishes and real silver wear, but no paper towels or any tissue! These small things would have been a plus; otherwise the room is great, was clean and the bed was very comfy!
There was barely enough parking in the neighborhood!
Also messaging to the host was pleasant!
reviews/2/comments: Vivi and her husband did a good job of taking care of us and making sure the stay went smoothly...all without being intrusive.  We are very grateful and would love to stay again, if the opportunity presents itself.  Thank you!
reviews/3/comments: First & foremost the host was super accommodating. I was delayed on getting in and Vivi met me downstairs and walked me thru check in, even drove with me to find all the guest spots since it gets so dark so early at this time of year. I worked 12 to 13 hr days so didn't spend much time at the rental but it was nice, clean and  comfortable  to get a good nights rest. Thanks so much!
reviews/4/comments: Absolutely lovely location, host and space. Quiet and peaceful. Bird wetland sanctuary for afternoon strolls. Close to shopping and downtown Basalt. Space felt safe and was immaculately clean.
reviews/5/comments: This is a wonderful stay in a beautiful mountain town. Vivi and Sebastian are very kind and willing to share a chat or some lunch with you. Their place is very clean and they have thought of everything. Next time I’m in the area, I will certainly check to see if this place is available.
reviews/6/comments: Great place to stay to commute to Maroon Bells. This space was clean, check-in was easy and the host was friendly. We did keep our privacy for the most part. We did not utilize the upstairs but there again we were out hiking pretty much all day the entire time we were there. We would stay here again.
reviews/7/comments: This is a great place. Very clean and with access to the kitchen. Otherwise it’s completely private. Close to public transit . Vivi and Sebastian are super nice and fun to talk to.
reviews/8/comments: I had a great stay with Viviane! Loved the room and the location was perfect.
reviews/9/comments: Perfect location for the area. Viviane was very helpful and always quick to answer any questions. Walking path nearby along with access by bus with electric bikes to rent nearby.

name: Secluded Mt. Sopris View apartment
reviews/0/comments: If you're staying in Glenwood, this is the place to be. Just a few minutes from downtown, amazing view, and super cozy. Linda has put so much thought into this place and there are so many small touches to make you comfy.
reviews/1/comments: The pictures do not do this place justice. It is roomy, comfy and the location and view are immaculate. I felt very welcomed and comfortable. Would definitely come back again
reviews/2/comments: The AirBnB was in a great location that gave you privacy and a sense of escaping to the mountains. The location was very close to downtown so it was very easy to explore the sights of the town or have something to eat quickly. We would gladly stay here again next time we are in the area.
reviews/3/comments: This apartment is beautifully decorated and spacious. The neighborhood is quiet, so peaceful. The host responds to o messages promptly.
reviews/3/response: Thank you, again, for staying with us.  We’re happy you enjoyed our property.  Please come back again!
reviews/4/comments: Clean and comfy - with an incredible view!!
reviews/4/response: Thank you for staying with us.  We enjoyed hosting you.
reviews/5/comments: Great place to stay!! We were well taken care of by Linda (the host) and property it is in a terrific location. She also treated us to a bottle of wine and additional snacks. Only knock...Don't think a lot of places in the mountains have AC due to the usual cold weather. Needed it during our stay since it was abnormally hot, but we could not find it. We may just not have looked hard enough for the AC if there was one as it was late at night, but other than that, an awesome spot and I highly recommend it to anyone staying in the Glenwood area.
reviews/5/response: Thank you Alec for mentioning the AC.  There is AC in the unit, but controlled on my main level.  Good to know I need to keep it on for apartment when we have these short heat waves.  Glad you enjoyed your visit - come back any time!
reviews/6/comments:
The space is in a beautiful neighborhood with a front porch that has an amazing view for morning coffee. We felt close enough to town that driving to the hot springs and Hanging Lake Trail was quick but we didn’t feel overwhelmed by the business of downtown tourism. The host was so kind and communicative! We would definitely stay in the space again.
The host team thought of everything from toiletries to kitchen utensils, even a personalized note at check in.

name: Marriott StreamSide Birch 1BD/2BA max 6
reviews/0/comments: Perfect. Exactly as described
reviews/1/comments: Great place to stay when in Vail!
reviews/2/comments: My family who stayed there gushed at how amazing it was, with one balcony overlooking the river and the other over the mountains! Great day, thanks so much!
reviews/3/comments: This place was perfect! 2 decks, a full kitchen, 2 couches, fireplace, 2 bathrooms! Super close to I70 so great for traveling. I wish we could have stayed longer!
reviews/4/comments: Great unit with lots of room. The resort has beautiful pools/ hot tubs and nice staff.  The Recreation path is right out the front door and is lovely as well.
reviews/5/comments: Absolute great stay for the price. Amazing value. You have a hot tub next to the building you stay in and then a pool hot tub steam room and sauna at the main building. Only thing to be aware is there is no room service so bring some food. Room was spacious , and comfortable. And you have two balcony’s. 10/10 would stay again
reviews/6/comments: Great place close to town, I’d definitely stay again
reviews/7/comments: Wonderful place, wonderful location, wonderful everything!!!
reviews/8/comments: This is a wonderful unit, very clean, nicely decorated, and very convenient just off of the interstate. We enjoyed our stay there.
reviews/9/comments: Outstanding place to stay. Everything you need is here! Location and amenities are amazing.

name: CABIN 13 - Cozy Rustic-Luxury A-FRAME w/ Kitchen
reviews/0/comments: Great one night stay for everything my husband and I needed:) comfy and cute. Close to doc holliday and that’s all that mattered to us. :)
reviews/1/comments: We had a great time staying at Kristine's cabin. Our hosts were great communicators and the cabin is in a perfect location. We were less than a mile from the Iron Mountain Hot Springs and the gondola rides to the caverns. We did the Hanging Lake hike, which is a quick 15 min drive from the cabin. We would definitely return either for the hikes or for skiing when the snow comes in.
reviews/2/comments: It was such a cute and cozy cabin. Its very close to anything one can hope to do during their stay. I will definitely visit again in the future.
reviews/3/comments: perfect, comfortable and cozy! it was very clean, great location and easy to access!
reviews/4/comments: Such a cute little place! Super close to everything and downtown area! Nice and clean place perfect for a getaway!
reviews/5/comments: Easy check in, great space, 10/10
reviews/6/comments: Great little place in a great location right by the highway perfect for a quick overnight stop
reviews/7/comments: The cabin was the perfect size, very cozy and clean. It’s located a few minutes from the hot springs which was very convenient. We had a wonderful stay!
reviews/8/comments: This was a perfect place to stay. It was comfy, and the owners had thought of lots of little things that would make us comfortable. Great location, just outside of the busiest part of town, but still quick to get to the things we wanted to do. There are nice shaded common areas outside to sit and relax.
reviews/9/comments: Clean and cozy! Definitely will come back!

name: Cozy Victorian walk to town, stores
reviews/0/comments: Such a welcoming and safe place to stay while exploring the Roaring Fork Valley. Price is great and location super convenient!
reviews/1/comments: A charming home in a super convenient location.  The hosts are gracious, laid back, and very hospitable.  Highly recommended.
reviews/2/comments: Thank you, Felicia and Krishna, for being such kind and lovely hosts. The home is charming, and the bedroom was surprisingly bigger than expected for a little Victorian home. The neighborhood is extremely safe and quiet, and the home is walking distance to town. Overall, this was a nice place to stay at.
reviews/3/comments: Super comfortable, clean, convenient to town and easy to get to. Felicia is truly a "superhost"- reliable, responsive and very kind. The space is very welcoming and feels like home.
reviews/4/comments: I love Carbondale and grew up in the area. Felicia's house is all the eclectic things I love about Carbondale. Close to downtown.
reviews/5/comments: Felicia was very hospitable and friendly.  She got back to me quickly on reservation and check in and she provided me with good local information.
reviews/6/comments:
Felicia and Krishna were so nice and friendly with us, they were there for every little thing and detail to make sure we were comfortable and happy. it was an amazing experience truly just spending time with them and their little dog Shanty ♥️.
The house was very welcoming and cozy, also it’s very well located.
reviews/7/comments: I went to Carbondale for a yoga course, staying at Felicia’s was a great experience for us; I really liked the room and style of the house. Felicia is a great host, always with a smile and great attitude. I would definitely would come back to stay with her.
reviews/8/comments: Great location and very comfortable. Just what we needed for our hiking trip!
reviews/9/comments: The house is on a side street a close walk to town, with cozy rooms and a peaceful vibe that permeates the space.  We especially enjoyed sitting on the porch one afternoon, sipping a beverage and enjoying perfect weather.  The space was ideal for us, and we will certainly return.

name: The Bear's Den
reviews/0/comments: The Bears Den was perfect! Very clean and cozy. Mark was very informative and gave us great ideas for our stay in Glenwood. The bed was very comfy and we will definitely check to see if we can stay again when we visit Glenwood. Thanks for sharing your lovely home.
reviews/1/comments: Highly recommend this Airbnb.  Perfect place to reach hiking, mountain biking and spending time in the river.
reviews/2/comments: We so enjoyed our stay at Bear’s Den. It’s a cute home located close to Glenwood Spring’s best restaurants and bike paths, yet far enough from the hustle and bustle, it was very peaceful and quiet. Mark, the owner, was very quick to respond to questions we may have had. The house was well-equipped as far as cooking needs, and it was impeccably clean. We enjoyed our stay so much, we’re already talking about returning in the future.
reviews/3/comments: This is a great location and place to stay if visiting Glenwood Springs. I enjoyed being out of the city and the peaceful environment but able to be in the town within 5-10 minutes. Ideal for us.
reviews/4/comments: Such a cute and quiet spot but convenient to down town. Clean and just about everything you could need is provided. Loved our stay!
reviews/5/comments: Wonderful place to stay close to Glenwood. Felt very private and cozy with everything we needed for our stay.  We will come back again soon.
reviews/6/comments:
Mark's place is truly a fantastic place from which to explore Glenwood and the surrounding area. Has real country charm with just a 10 minute drive into town. We loved our stay and would recommend to everyone.
Thanks Mark!
reviews/7/comments: The Bears Den is the perfect Glenwood getaway! Mark is a wonderful host! My mom and I loved everything about it!
reviews/8/comments: The location was cozy and remote. Easy access to the main town as well as activities in the area. We had a great stay!
reviews/9/comments: It was wonderful thank you!

name: Stay w/ Friends & Save Snowmass! Pool/HT, Gas FP
reviews/0/comments: Kim’s place was clean and fully stocked with cooking necessities. Easy access to her agent who responded quickly.  Very affordable and convenient.
reviews/0/response:
Geoffrey,
We are so pleased to hear how much you enjoyed your stay at the Aspenwood. We think this condo is a great little spot to call home during your visit to Snowmass. It is great to know you found it to be a good value for your experience. We would be delighted to have you as our guest again!
Kim Allen
iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/1/comments: Great place to stay. Close to Aspen, Maroon Bells and Glenwood Springs. Great central location.  There is a nice  grocery store on the mountain and nice places to eat and shop. Would definitely stay again next May.
reviews/1/response: Brandy, I am so happy to hear that the location was great for your stay. The location is hard to beat! We hope you come back and stay with us again! Katie, iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/2/comments: Convenient and place to stay
reviews/2/response: Joe, I am happy to hear that this property was convenient for your stay! We hope you come back again! Katie, iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/3/comments: Great location (2 min walk to slopes), and responsive, helpful hosts. Highly recommend to anyone looking to ski Snowmass!
reviews/3/response: Tia, I am so pleased to hear the location and our guest services added to your time here! We hope you come back and stay with us again! Katie, iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/4/comments: Just what we needed for our Thanksgiving ski trip.
reviews/4/response:
Loren,
We are pleased to know your family enjoyed your Thanksgiving vacation and had some fun on the slopes! Thank you for coming to stay with us and we hope to host you again in the future.
Kim and Kim
iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/5/comments: Great ski location! Small and cozy!
reviews/5/response:
Aidan,
We are happy to hear you were pleased with your stay! Please think of us again when planning your next visit!
Kim and Kim
iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/6/comments: We had a wonderful time in Snowmass! The rental was super clean and comfortable! It had everything you needed for a perfect week away. The host went out of their way to check in with us and make sure everything was perfect. Thank you again for sharing the wonderful spot!
reviews/6/response: Maggie, We are happy to hear you had such a positive stay with us. We truly want to make sure every guest has the best stay in our properties. We hope you come back soon and stay with us again. Katie, iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/7/comments:
The good - Kim's responsiveness and help throughout our stay was excellent. 2 Hot tubs are big and hot! Pool amenities and sauna were awesome.
The bad - Place is dated and in need of renovation. Carpets are drab and smell old, and the bathroom is pretty sad. Shower is small for someone 5'5" or over. It gets pretty hot during summer, and no AC, so only fans and open windows to cool you down. It cools down late at night so it's manageable.
reviews/7/response:
David,
Thank you for taking time to review your stay with us. The Aspenwood is a great place for a vacation in Snowmass and this condo is a terrific value when coming to explore the area. The homeowner is working on plans for a remodel of the condo but in the meantime we work hard to keep it clean and functioning for guests looking for an affordable vacation. Most condos in this area do not have AC so fans and open windows are essential in providing a comfortable place to relax.
Kim and Kim
iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/8/comments: Very good location and good price.  Worked very well for my kids and I during our five day August stay.  Kim was very quick to respond to any questions or requests.
reviews/8/response: Michael, thank you for your review! We are happy to see you had a great time at our Aspenwood condo in Snowmass! We strive in providing excellent customer service to ensure your have the most perfect vacation, and are thrilled to see that our team was quick to respond and assist with any questions. Please think of us next time you visit Snowmass! Best, Danielle iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass
reviews/9/comments: We really enjoyed our stay at Kim’s condo! It was very clean and comfortable and was a great deal. The hot tub is fantastic! Two things of note- you cannot stand up in the loft. This is indicated in the listing, but it was still a bit of a surprise. The beams overhead are carpeted though and we didn’t have a problem. The other thing is that there is also no AC. With the fans running and the windows open, it cooled down pretty well though.
reviews/9/response: Rachel, we are thrilled to see you enjoyed your stay at our Aspenwood condo in Snowmass. We are happy the condo was clean and comfortable during your stay, and that the loft did not cause any problems! Many condos in Snowmass do not have AC, so we equip ourselves with many fans and cooling instructions to make it comfortable  during the few hot Summer days! Best, Danielle, iTrip Vacations Aspen Snowmass

name: Creekside Cabin at Four Mile Creek B & B
reviews/0/comments: Honestly I don't think you could ask for more. The property is very unique, and Jim is an incredible host. For my wife and I we felt like we were visiting friends. The creek that runs through the property is so relaxing it lulls you to sleep at night. The scenery is beautiful.
reviews/1/comments: Amazing quite place. Extremely relaxing.
reviews/2/comments: Jim and his wife are excellent hosts. This is a really special place, and I can't recommend it enough. The cabin was so cozy and peaceful. Breakfast was perfect. Can't wait to return!
reviews/3/comments: Delightfully quaint and comfortable in beautiful surroundings. Amazing hosts make the stay even more memorable. Perfect for a reset and recharge.
reviews/4/comments: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed staying at the bed and breakfast. The landscape was perfect. The cabin is bigger than anticipated. The pictures don’t do this place Justice. The sound of the creek is very peaceful. We will definitely try to go back.
reviews/5/comments: Great location and hospitality. Very much enjoyed the stay.
reviews/6/comments: My family had such a wonderful time staying at the Creekside Cabin. Everything was idyllic and beautiful, this B&B is such a gem. The hosts entertained all of our 5 year old son's inquiries and shared their home with us! We look forward to staying again in the future.
reviews/7/comments: Beautiful property. Lovely hosts, very welcoming. Delicious breakfast.
reviews/8/comments: Great stay . Breakfast that was supplied every day was delicious, Cabin was comfy and exactly as described. Creek was right outside window and entire location peaceful . Will absolutely stay again.
reviews/9/comments: Cute little spot with great hosts!

name: 504 | Ski in/out at Beaver Creek. No Cleaning Fee!
reviews/0/comments: Oliver's place was perfect for a weekend wedding getaway. The view from the bedroom is gorgeous, the shuttles were fantastic for getting to all of the festivities, and the bed was super comfortable to rest and recharge. Thank you, Oliver!
reviews/1/comments: Perfect stay for a couple.
reviews/2/comments:
Great place to stay at in Beaver Creek! Great location and the condo works perfectly for a couple.

Just note that there is a parking 30 USD per night fee if you are parking at the hotel!
reviews/3/comments: Great location—place was exactly as described!
reviews/4/comments: Great location and very comfortable.
reviews/5/comments: great location and value      perfect for business and pleasure
reviews/6/comments: Great location, convenient to the slopes and the town. The condo was clean and as pictured. Nice view from the bedroom.
reviews/7/comments: Very nice place in a great location.
reviews/8/comments: Great place to stay.  Great proximity to the slopes and BC Village.
reviews/9/comments: Great place, and was very easy to find, check in, and enjoy!

name: Forest Fortress at the Cloud City Castle & Hot Tub
reviews/0/comments: Really nice stay in beautiful house.
reviews/1/comments: Clean place, super convenient, close to downtown!  Awesome!
reviews/2/comments:
Lovely house.
Cozy and convenient to everything we needed.
Host was warm and welcoming.
Thanks!
reviews/3/comments: Nice big place. Easily walkable to anywhere you want to go in Leadville.
reviews/4/comments: Home is spacious and Nathan is a great host. Super comfortable and would stay there again!
reviews/5/comments: Very neat spot, perfect for relaxing after exploring the outdoors. Super comfortable beds!
reviews/6/comments: This was such a fantastic stay for the night. Close to everywhere you want to be in Leadville. One of the most comfortable beds I’ve slept in.  Highly recommend staying here.  My only complaint is that I didn’t have more time to stay in this charming house. If my path ever takes me back to this part of the mountains, I will be staying here.
reviews/7/comments: Nice old house with a well stocked kitchen and plenty of tech around. Only strange thing is sharing the backyard or hot tub with anyone else staying in the connecting unit.
reviews/8/comments: Great place. Super roomy and clean!
reviews/9/comments: One of the most unique homes I've stayed at; it even had a cute guest book, and Nathan was the most responsive host I've ever had. Checking in and checking out was really easy. The king sized bed mattress was super comfortable and the home was incredibly spacious. Leadville is slightly more chilly than Denver but we had no issues with getting hot water or the heater on; in fact, warm water came really fast and the home got warm really quickly too. The house was super convenient to get to Mt Elbert and walkable distances to restaurants and shops. Would definitely stay here again if we wanted to do another 14ner in the area.

name: The Villa Costalotta
reviews/0/comments: Loved staying here! It’s charming and comfortable, and the location is stunning with Brush Creek out the back and rolling hills in front. JoAnn was the perfect host!
reviews/1/comments: Great locationandgreat value. Lovely place to stay. Hidden gem and I plan on going back.
reviews/2/comments: We loved the Villa Costalotta.  It's very comfortable and is just right for our needs.
reviews/3/comments: Nice clean place near the mountain bike trails. Just what I needed.
reviews/4/comments: Spacious.  Comfortable bed.  Outstanding service.
reviews/5/comments: There's a reason why this place is 5.0.  Cute, cozy, and full of thoughtful touches.  JoAnn and Bob are wonderful hosts.  Be sure to read the articles about them on the table :)  Sitting on the deck having coffee by the creek was a perfect start to our mornings.
reviews/6/comments: The cabin is the perfect location to relax & explore Eagle & surroundings. Creek side breakfast/dinner table is the best. Cabin decorations is perfect. For two people it’s amazing place. JoAnn & Bob are wonderful host & were available to help all the time.
reviews/7/comments:
This charming little log cabin resting along a rushing creek with views of the mountains and heavens was absolutely breathtaking!!

The hummingbirds through the day and beautiful flowers felt peaceful and warm. This guest house is very clean and has a couple heaters too to warm up on cool nights.

In dusk and dawn, why not enjoy a cup of coffee or tea on the back deck over looking a creek, mountains, and the heavens!?!
reviews/8/comments: Staying in this cabin was such a treat! I was worried that you couldn't hear the creek from the cabin, boy was I wrong. open the bathroom window and the creek sounds wonderful. The cabin was super cute, very clean, and for those who don't like bugs, very well insulated, which also mean the temperature always stayed nice. If felt refreshing to stay at an airbnb that truly felt like home (vs. someone who just flipped a property to rent it). Our conversation with Bob was very special and communication with JoAnn was excellent. If I'm ever in the area again, I will heartbeat again in a heatbeat.
reviews/9/comments: The Villa Costalotta was charming and peaceful.  The home succeeded my expectations.  Of course, Bob's homemade fudge was the icing on the cake.  When Bob learned I was in town to visit my granddaughter's he prepared additional fudge to give to them.  They are great hosts.  I gained two new friends. Thanks so much for your gracious hospitality.

name: RUEDI CREEK TREASURE! (Ruedi Reservoir BASALT)
reviews/0/comments: Jeanne’s home was exactly what we were looking for! The space was super comfortable and the setting up in the mountains was beautiful. We all loved the character of the house and details that went into making our stay a pleasure.
reviews/1/comments: That’s a paradise ! Everything around house and inside one are fantastic!!!
reviews/2/comments: There are so many eye catching and interesting pieces of artwork in this place. It was extremely clean and well taken care of. The drive there from downtown Basalt was fantastic, through the canyons along the meandering river with lots of meadows and red rock. Loved it!
reviews/3/comments: Very unique house. Has a great firepit with firewood provided. Brought Starlink with us, but the owner actually has  Starlink already installed (low latency for wifi calling, fast enough for 4k streaming and pretty much anything else). This is one of the 3 houses on the property, so even though you are away from most people, it's not that secluded. Would definitely come back again though.
reviews/4/comments: The house was as advertised.  The house had everything you needed from cooking utensil’s to furniture inside and outside to enjoy the location in nature.  Jeanne was great and easy to communicate with.
reviews/5/comments: What a stunning house! The space is absolutely gorgeous, with stunning views and wonderful amenities. We had everything we needed (and more!), with comfy furniture, spacious rooms, outdoor spaces, games and the most perfect kitchen I've ever been in! This is a wonderful place to "get away" to, and is close to lots of fun activities (like hiking trails and the reservoir). Jeanne provided very thorough arrival instructions which made check in super easy. This was a unique, charming space that we can't wait to return to if we have a chance!
reviews/6/comments: A beautiful home in a beautiful setting-a true retreat! Jeanne is a wonderful host and we appreciated her flexibility.
reviews/7/comments: Hands down the best and most unique mountain house we have stayed in yet.
reviews/8/comments: It was a very nice secluded home.  We were really pleased and recommend this place for quiet get aways.
reviews/9/comments:
Jeanne’s place is amazing ! It’s such a beautiful house and everything is so prefect! We were stuck here during a snow storm and the house had some staples like rice, jams etc and we were able to manage comfortably.

The views from the house were so amazing ! The master bedroom had a breathtaking views of the mountains . Would definitely love to come back !

name: Marriotts Streamside at Vail - Spacious 1 Bedroom
reviews/0/comments: Great place in the vail valley which made for a unforgettable trip
reviews/1/comments: Clean and accommodating!
reviews/2/comments: Great support and anticipation from Christian for an easy check-in.
reviews/3/comments:
Christian was great! Pictures were a little inaccurate because the implied 2 beds, but instead we had 1 bed and 1 hide-a-bed. There also wasn’t any air conditioning like the description said. However, Vail is a gorgeous place in the summer so thankfully it wasn’t too hot.
Overall, it was a great stay! Loved having the full kitchen and the locations is breath taking!
reviews/4/comments: BEAUTIFUL!
reviews/5/comments: Very nice place
reviews/6/comments: good location and very comfortable beds! only con is there isn’t a shuttle to the vail village.

name: Aspenwood Condo! Downtown Snowmass
reviews/0/comments: We had a great stay!  Awesome location, space, and pool. So easy to walk on the mall and take the gondola down to the base village . Free bus down to Aspen a short walk. Good value ! Thanks Morgan we hope to return !
reviews/1/comments: Would stay again. Great spot, centrally located!
reviews/2/comments: Great location. Need some updates to refresh the look.
reviews/3/comments: Great location for hiking and biking. Very spacious and comfortable . Kitchen could use an update, but everything worked. Hot tub was nice and close to the village . We had a great time .
reviews/4/comments: We had a great stay and it was exactly what we were looking for. The place is nothing nothing fancy, but is exactly as described and as the photos show. The location was great for what we were looking for. We did enjoyed the hot tub and walked the the mall mall area too. Happy with our choice to stay here.
reviews/5/comments:
Pictures are up to date. I'd say it was fine since we spent most of our time out and about. I wouldn't recommend it if you will be spending a significant amount of time in the unit just because of lack of creature comforts which can be seen in the pictures.

Check in was a little confusing, but easy once you called the front desk which Morgan gives you the info for. Be aware that per resort policy they will place an additional (charge/room deposit) on your card upon check in (in addition to your AirBnb reservations).
reviews/6/comments: Great place to stay if your skiing at Snowmass! Easy walk to the slopes and the village. Definitely recommend.
reviews/7/comments: Easy to park, stroll to the town centers, get onto the slopes. Well situated and all you need close by.
reviews/8/comments: lovelyand cozy stay :)
reviews/9/comments: Great place to stay

name: Inn the Clouds - Mt. Massive #6
reviews/0/comments: nice cozy and clean place . lots of books . very good location .
reviews/1/comments: Simple but had everything one would need
reviews/2/comments: On my way to aspen and decided to stay here at INN THE CLOUDS. Super cute hostel. Private room was nice and cozy. Gave me a tour around the place which was nice to make me feel welcome and comfortable. Offered the kitchen and a place to store my goods in the fridge. Which I didn’t need but nice to know they care enough to offer a big kitchen with everything you need to cook. Two pretty living rooms filled with books and a tv to lounge in.  Highly recommend if you want to take the 1 1/2 hour trip to aspen. 🥰
reviews/3/comments: Welcomes the guest and gives a tour of the place!
reviews/4/comments: I had a great time and met lots of cool people at Inn the Clouds
reviews/5/comments: Our stay at the hostel was great. everyone was super friendly, the place was impeccable, and Kent made check in a breeze even with our pup. The location was also just a few blocks away from town which made going to grab a bite or drink very easy!
reviews/6/comments: This is a good stop if you’re in Leadville, we were passing through on our road trip and needed a place for the night. The host was very informative and gave us a whole tour when we arrived. We kept to ourselves but everyone seemed nice there. What you see is what you get. I thought the price was a little high for being just a bed in a room with communal bathrooms but it’s relative to everything!
reviews/7/comments: cute and cozy little hostel! my pup and I loved our stay here
reviews/8/comments: Great convenient spot in Leadville. Walkable to town for food, or cook in the kitchen there at the hostel. Super nice hosts, made everything very simple. There are two separate living room/hangout areas which is nice, and a 10pm quiet policy means you get plenty of sleep for whatever you’re doing in the mountains the next day.
reviews/9/comments: Excellent hostel! Easy, clean, friendly. Just what I was looking for. Highly recommend!

name: Tiny House Maverick in downtown Leadville
reviews/0/comments: Awesome tiny home, must be agile to get up into the bed lofts. Great use of space!
reviews/1/comments: Fun house. Make sure you can climb a ladder or steep stairs to go to bed.  Close to shops and restaurants.
reviews/2/comments: Awesome tiny home. Would gladly stay again!
reviews/3/comments: Enjoyed our quick stay in this tiny house. Our kids loved it. I appreciated the easy check in and close location to downtown Leadville. Wish we could have stayed longer!
reviews/4/comments: Exactly as the listing indicated. Great location to explore Leadville and the surrounding area. It worked for two of us, that said it can accommodate 4. We had a blast using this as home base.
reviews/5/comments: Awesome spot!
reviews/6/comments: Nice Tiny home. Good location to walk the massive strip of Leadville.
reviews/7/comments: Cute, clean, fun little spot walking distance to plenty of good Leadville exploration.
reviews/8/comments: This is great tiny home! My wife and I were only here for one night, but it was a great time. Check in was difficult, however the place was very clean and nice.
reviews/9/comments: Great spot, walking distance to the main strip. It’s for sure a tiny home! So don’t be caught off guard but it was very lovely and we enjoyed our stay.

name: #1 Private room Downtown Leadville dog friendly
reviews/0/comments: Very clean, great communication. Lots of extra touches that make a wonderful stay, we will stay again for sure!!
reviews/1/comments: A little quirky and so welcoming, we enjoyed our brief stay. The bedding was very comfortable, and the location was a short and easy walk to restaurants, bars and shops on the main strip. well there is some sound bleed through between the rooms, the owners were considerate enough to leave a noise machine in the room and provide ear plugs if needed. we had no problem sleeping. We'll be back for another stay, and definitely recommend.
reviews/2/comments: This was a great place to stay for us since we were hiking out near Leadville the next morning. It was clean and the goodie bag was very nice of the host to leave for us. The place was clean and quiet
reviews/3/comments: Very easy to book. Messed up my booking and they were extremely understanding and helpful. Comfortable bed. Like the options available in the room to avoid noise from the road. Slept well. Thanks again!
reviews/4/comments: We were happy with the stay.
reviews/5/comments: Highly recommend! Great location and wifi, very accommodating host. I already want to go back!!
reviews/6/comments: Great little place for race crew and pacers that was convenient for race weekend.  Easy to find.  Very clean.  Had the essentials. And plenty of outlets!!
reviews/7/comments: Cute little motel style room fitting of the Leadville vibe.  Ting is a wonderful host and took the time to personally chat with us, offer dining suggestions and general info regarding the town.   Our room was very comfortable, 2 comfortable king beds, ample towels and French Press for in room coffee.  Bonus "goodie" bag too.   Really great stay!
reviews/8/comments: Mountain Peaks met our needs perfectly for a two night stay in Leadville.  So conveniently located on the main street, we walked to all shops and restaurants during our stay. I was concerned about highway noise, but it really quiets down nicely in the evening.  We slept great. Also a short drive to the Elbert and Massive trailheads. Ting was very accommodating and adds so many thoughtful touches. The beds and pillows were SO comfortable. Room clean and tidy. Gift bag with useful hiking goodies :). Great value too. We would definitely stay again!
reviews/9/comments: We loved staying at the mountain peaks motel- Ting has done such a wonderful job making the place feel homey and almost luxurious with the attention to detail. The location is so convenient and we loved visiting Leadville for 14ers and Twin Lakes access and are already planning our next trip. So nice to have a dog friendly place to stay as well. We would gladly stay here again! 5/5 stars

name: The Birds Nest. River front & Mt Sopris Views
reviews/0/comments: Awesome experience, beautiful views, wildlife viewing from the patio, clean quiet, peaceful relaxing vaca!   thank you
reviews/1/comments: The location is great and the host Molly is super nice and friendly. I would love to stay there while traveling Roaring Fork Valley.
reviews/2/comments: Amazing stay at an amazing location. Molly is a wonderful host. We really made memories here.
reviews/3/comments: Great quiet location that’s really relaxing. The place is really clean and spacious. Love the sound of the river behind the place. Close enough to all the activities and  a nice place to come back to after a long day of activities.
reviews/4/comments: Really nice place to stay
reviews/5/comments: This was such a great experience.  We were so comfortable and the whole trip was so relaxing. Molly is a fantastic host and we can't wait to come back.
reviews/6/comments: Lovely quiet space. Close access to everything yet far enough for solitude. indoor space was comfortable and had all the necessities. Patio area was a great spot for dinner & bird watching. We loved seeing a bald eagle fly by & an osprey perched in a nearby tree.
reviews/7/comments: What can I say… picturesque views from the apartment and patio. Perfectly located on the Roaring Fork River with mountains surrounding. The space is perfectly decorated and has everything you need! My wife and I had a short stay, but loved every minute. We were able to travel up to Aspen (only 40 minutes away) to visit the town and spend a few hours seeing Maroon Bells. We also took advantage of the scenery right by the apartment to snap a few pregnancy photos of my wife. Thank you Molly for a great stay!
reviews/8/comments: This is truly an incredible place right on the river.   It is so peaceful and quiet with only the sound of the river to sooth you.  The unit was perfect with everything you would need or want.  The bathroom is HUGE!  Bed is comfortable and it is perfectly located between Glenwood and Carbondale.  We wanted to ride our ebikes and were pleased at how close this unit is to bike trails.  We loved all of the special touches in the unit.  A wonderful stay!
reviews/9/comments: Our stay at Molly’s place was great! The space was so comfy, the views were breathtaking, and Molly was an amazing host! Go check this place out.

name: Yellowstone @ Mountain Hideaway w/ Hot Tub, Gym
reviews/0/comments: The room was a decent value because the location was so ideal. The room itself was very hot even in 40-50 degree weather. There was a fan however even with the window open the thermostat was reading 78-81 while I was there which made it hard to sleep. I would suggest they do something about that since I can’t imagine in the summer how hot the room must get.
reviews/0/response:
Hi Whitney,
Thank you for your feedback and suggestion. This will help us improve moving forward. We hope to have the opportunity to host you gain in the future.
reviews/1/comments: Amazing! Easy check in. Clean shower. Friendly environment. Easy to navigate and walk through. I’m 6”3’ and I found this place to be surprisingly roomy.
reviews/2/comments: Wonderful place!!  We will definitely book again!!
reviews/3/comments: Great spot! Definitely has a hostel vibe, but totally comfy and sweet!
reviews/4/comments: I rarely leave reviews but this was such a good value that I will leave a review now.  The room was located only two blocks from the main downtown road.  I was having a hard time finding ANY rooms/hotels in Leadville. They were either not available or WAY too expense. This was my best option from a location perspective and also the lease (Website hidden by Airbnb) far.  The house/room was easy to find. The access was fast and easy. Alex and Nadim had great communication before and during my stay. The room and bathroom was cozy and clean.  In a nutshell, this delivered 5 Stars for what you hope from and expect from an AB&B experience.  Thank you - Mark T
reviews/5/comments: Had an excellent stay. It is a little bit a hostel with a more mature vibe, and I had some great interactions with the other guests. Combined with a very central location (but far enough from main street to not have the noise), and lots of amenities make for a great place to stay in Leadville. The place offers great value for money, but since it's somewhat cheaper than most places in town, I think it's okay that there are a few issues here and there, like the hot tub stopped working and became cold (when I was checking out, someone stopped by to repair it). Also, most of the kitchen stuff was in good shape, but some other things were somewhat old/broken, and there is not a great selection of pots and pans. The charm of the older building, means also that you can hear the others walking through the house. None of the guests were overly noisy or so when I was there, but I did hear some of the guests leaving early morning. But again, it's unreasonable to expect everything to be perfect for such a price. The only thing that I found truly annoying was that they were pushing another app for the check-in process, but the hosts were friendly and sent the codes through a text message when I asked, saving me from the hassle of having to install this DACK app and having to create yet another online account to simply access the room.
reviews/6/comments: Just visited Leadville and the location is beautiful , I was looking forward to the tub but unfortunately it wasn’t working . The temperature in our room was kinda hot because the ac didn’t work and the fan only circulated hot air . People I met during my stay were wonderful and the vibes were all there . Hope that they fix theses issues and I wouldn’t think twice about booking
reviews/6/response:
Hi Jeimy,

Thank you for your feedback. We are glad to hear that overall you enjoyed your stay! Just to clarify, the home does not have AC and we do not advertise it. In the mountains the nights tend to be very cool, (we provide fans and opening windows help on the warmer days). In addition, there were no reports of the hot tub not working. We do provide a phone number and email where we can be contacted and had we known, we could have sent someone by to take a look. We hope this information is helpful and that you stay with us again in the future. Thank you.
reviews/7/comments: It’s was great
reviews/8/comments: The room was as in the photos. Close to downtown.
reviews/9/comments: Such a cool little room! Convenient location, clean, very responsive and overall great stay!

name: Marriott StreamSide Douglas Vail 1Bed, 2Bath max 6
reviews/0/comments: This was a great rental!  Tara is super quick to reply and check in was very easy!  Loved staying at the Streamside!
reviews/1/comments: Tara was great. The place was perfect with all the amenities and space needed. Would highly recommend and plan a return trip in the near future.
reviews/2/comments:
Great location
Excellent amenities
reviews/3/comments:
Great location, cute and comfortable condo!
Tara responded to my questions quickly.
reviews/4/comments: the place very clean, quite nice and we were treated very well.  The entire process of both booking and arriving and leaving was very easy.
reviews/5/comments: We loved our stay in the Douglas building Would surely come back.
reviews/6/comments: Very clean and a Sara is a great host
reviews/7/comments: Nice place in a very convenient location.  Free shuttle to Lionshead was quick and easy too.  Would stay here again.
reviews/8/comments:
Tara’s place is perfect and exactly what a group of 2 or 3 need in Vail. Very nice, convenient located, clean, and great amenities. I’ll be staying here again next time I’m in town!

Only minor issue was that the bedroom was kind of cold (maybe around 68 degrees) and wouldn’t seem to heat up as I turned up the thermostat. The living room heat up well though. Not that big of an issue though, and definitely not a deal breaker. Still deserves 5 stars!
reviews/9/comments: We decided stay in Vail last minute. Tara responded quickly and approved our request. Everything is as described in the listing. It is located 5 minutes drive from Downtown and just a couple of minutes to Safeway and some small restaurants. Place was very clean and beds were very comfortable. The kitchen had everything you need to cook and make coffee. There are ton of amenities on the site. We will be coming back again. Thank you.

name: Tiny House Aspen in downtown Leadville
reviews/0/comments: Easy to find, felt safe and clean. My dog loved it. Just what we needed for the night!
reviews/1/comments: Great affordable place within walking distance to Leadvilles Main Street. One thing to beware: the loft bed is very uncomfortable, tight, and almost unsleepable for tall people! If you’re more than 6’ tall, you may have to sleep on the futon below.
reviews/2/comments: This place was absolutely wonderful! The listing is correct in everything it shows and all amenities. It’s a PERFECT location. Not even a 2 min drive to Main Street and then a 10 min walk. It was our first tiny house experience and it was lovely. Highly recommend!
reviews/3/comments: This was a great stay if you're interested in experiencing a tiny house! It would be a tight fit for more than two people, but that's to be expected. The location is very close to the main street in Leadville, although it is in an RV park. Perfect for a night or two stay.
reviews/4/comments: Loved my stay in the tiny house! I was only in Leadville for a night after a camping trip but this house was perfect for a solo vacation! The lofted area looks much bigger in the photos but it was comfortable for just myself. The house is in an RV park which is a little confusing when you first drive in, but it surrounded by other tiny homes. The house is located close to main street so it's easy to walk downtown for a bite and a drink. The kitchen was pretty well stocked but it was missing a few items (pepper and cooking oil).
reviews/5/comments: Very cute and convenient tinyhome in Leadville. Easy to find and check in. Great place if you are looking for a home base in town but might want to look else where if you’re looking for a place to hang. Loft was comfy by compact to where you couldn’t even bend your knees in bed. AC still leaks but only an issue at first while it was really hot.
reviews/6/comments: Great location and a great value! Easy to walk to Main Street for everything you need, and communication was really quick and easy. We’ll be back whenever we want to stay in Leadville!
reviews/7/comments: The tiny house itself was very nice and the proximity to town is great. It’s in a trailer park
reviews/8/comments: We absolutely loved our tiny house experience! Leadville is a true mountain town gem and we can’t recommend it enough. Visit Melanzana to get a melly jacket, the old silver dollar saloon for a beverage in a historic western saloon, and then get outside and enjoy all the outdoors of Leadville has to offer. We met incredible people in the tiny house village and made some great friends. The tiny house is perfect and we loved the experience. It had all we needed for our short stay. The loft bed in Aspen was a little tight for us so we opted for the futon instead, so for any tall or claustrophobic people, perhaps checkout the other tiny houses with more headroom over the bed, but we still loved our stay. Joe the property manager and the cleaning staff were amazing too!!
reviews/9/comments: Cute little place conveniently located in a charming little mountain town.

name: The get out of town into the mountains quiet cabin
reviews/0/comments: This cabin is a home away from home! Definitely recommend to those looking for a quiet, nature filled experience with incredibly kind and helpful hosts. Close to free hot springs, plenty hikes, and local food is 10/10. About a ten minute drive to local market and laundry. Hoping to visit again in the future!
reviews/1/comments: We had a great 5-day stay.  Comfortable (especially the bed), very convenient location, well equipped (for its size), peaceful surroundings.  Ideal spot for an outdoor breakfast. Anthony and Alexandra are very knowledgeable about the area and couldn't be nicer.
reviews/2/comments: what a beautiful littke get away❤️🙏🏻 great location 🎉 peaceful 🌺 just what we needed 🌺 trails🎉waterfalls 🎉 wildlife🐻 and lots of flowers.  Thanks again for sharing your cottage with us and being so kind.  🌸🌻🦋
reviews/3/comments: Amazing experience overall. The hosts welcomed us upon arrival and provided information about points of interest near by (even the hosts puppy, Delta, welcomed us). The Dollhouse was clean, remote, and provided the experience that was desired. You can tell that the hosts take pride in their property, ensuring that all guests have a relaxing and safe place to stay. An extremely comfortable bed, gorgeous views, and quaint environment made the experience at the Dollhouse great. Will definitely stay at the Dollhouse again when venturing back to the area.
reviews/4/comments: Beautiful little cabin.
reviews/5/comments: This is a great little spot if you are looking for a simple place to stay while still being close to the rest of the valley. Anthony and Alexandra were excellent hosts, and I would stay there again!
reviews/6/comments: Anthony and Alexandra were fantastic hosts!  Kind, communicative, and just overall wonderful humans!  They made sure we had everything we needed - from fresh towels and linens, plates/bowls/utensils, a french press and kettle, and even an actually sharp knife (we've stayed in enough AirBnB's to know this makes a difference haha)!  There was plenty of space to sit outside and relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery, and we even got out puppy fill in with their adorable dog Delta.  What a wonderful place for tiny home living, and a perfect midpoint to enjoy everything in the area - from Aspen to Marble, and all the hot springs in between, we were in the perfect location.  Thank you Anthony and Alexandra for a perfect stay out in the mountains!
reviews/7/comments: Wonderful place to stay. Very  easy going setting with wonderful hosts that are wonderful to talk with. Very accommodating and easy to get along with. Would 10/10 recommend.
reviews/8/comments: Wonderful hosts! Looking forward to staying here again!
reviews/9/comments: Dollhouse is a very nice guest house close to Aspen/Ashcroft and other amazing not crowded trails. The house itself is just the right size if you’re looking for a short getaway. The kitchen/bathroom set up took a little bit to sink in despite the pictures and description on the listing. The outdoor sitting area is perfect for morning coffee/early dinner where you get to see the beautiful mountain view, chipmunks, hummingbirds and other native birds. There’s a trail and creek behind the house as well that was just lovely!

name: E5
Studio Shred
reviews/0/comments: Great studio apartment! Clean, comfortable, and as an added bonus the kitchen was well-equipped. Convenient location and easy free parking.
reviews/1/comments: Perfect place to stay in Vail. Great location! The place was tidy and cozy.
reviews/2/comments: Thank you Jill! Your place is perfect for 2 people. My daughter and I loved being close to Vail Village & Beaver Creek. We also explored a cute town nearby called Midturn.  Rocking Tacos was amazing!  Thank you again!
reviews/3/comments: Affordable, convenient stay for two in Vail Valley. More than enough space and additional amenities in the kitchen and bathroom were a nice touch! Super clean & comfortable.
reviews/4/comments: This place was lovely to stay in. The only complaint I had is more a personal issue than an issue with the place- they have a strong smelling AirWick plugged in that my nose was sensitive to. I was able to unplug it for our trip and had a lovely time. The place was clean and just as pictured.
reviews/5/comments: Everything was as described and Jill’s communication was great! Would stay again.
reviews/6/comments: Very clean and modern. Super easy access. Not the closest to Vail Town but very easy and free transportation gets you in no time. Conveniently close to a supermarket and to a beautiful walking  by the river
reviews/7/comments: Jill's place was absolutely wonderful! perfect for a quiet solo stay in Vail. the space is airy with plenty of natural light seeping in. everything was so clean and organized upon check in with all basic necessities available. Jill was also a great communicator, always responding quickly and addressing needs. an all around great place to stay in
reviews/8/comments: Wonderful place! Perfect for my stay. If you need a nice loft in the Vail area, this is the place to stay
reviews/9/comments: Super awesome and clean. Kitchen was super nice, bathroom was nice. Check in and checkout process was easy, would definitely stay again.

name: Fourth of July!!! Christie Lodge
Riverside Grouse Creek Inn Right on The Eagle River
reviews/0/comments:
This is THE place to stay if you’re coming to Minturn, Vail or Beaver Creek. We had an incredible time and felt so at home, we didn’t want to leave! And you’re only a short 7-8 minute drive away from Vail Village.

The river right behind the home, with the perfect view of Lionshead and the trees - it feels like a dream every time you peek outside! We had a blast walking around downtown Minturn. Sunrise Minturn has the best breakfast and coffee we have had in a long time! And Rocky Mountain Taco was our favorite place for dinner. So cool and so easy to get to.
