There is also a great park close by called Little Beach if you have littles! We have a 2 year old and spent 5 days here. It was the perfect stay! They even have a little crate full of toys if you’re in need.

The home is perfectly styled and feels so cozy. The fireplaces are the best for those chilly mornings! And the curtains that divide the 2nd bed from the living area are actually very private and do a great job blocking out the light.

Spence and his family were so kind and so helpful when we would run into them. We felt like we were staying at a friends place. We will definitely be back!
reviews/1/comments: Really can't recommend this place highly enough.     From Spence being incredibly easy to get ahold of and easy to work with to the beautiful setting and home we had a wonderful stay.   The place itself is incredibly equipped with everything you could need.   The pictures pretty accurately portray the space and if anything it is actually nicer in person.    I almost alway have some sort of small complaint when we use airbnb but I really can't come up with anything here.   Just excellent.  And loved being close to Vail without actually staying there.   Minturn is a lovely little small town with some good restaurant options.
reviews/2/comments: We absolutely loved our stay in Minturn and plan to return. The space was cozy and inviting!
reviews/3/comments: This place is in a perfect spot to walk to shops, restaurants and bars. The river in the back is beautiful and peaceful. The fire place is so cozy and hot tub is great. The decor is adorable and definitely feel like you are in a Colorado cabin. Everything you need in the kitchen, bathroom etc. would definitely stay again. The bed in the bedroom is pretty bad unfortunately. It’s not a regular mattress, it’s a foam or bed in a bag I think, actually caused some pretty bad back issues for both my husband and I for a few days. The bed in the main room was great (we had to move)
reviews/3/response: Oh my goodness I'm so sorry! It is a brand new memory foam mattress, but when I changed the sheets after your visit, discovered it was installed upside down. That has been fixed and I'm so sorry we hadn't noticed before
reviews/4/comments:
Best spot. Walk to adorable Minturn. Best hiking trails only minutes away. Listen to the river rush by from anywhere in the apartment.
Riverstone fireplaces add so much beauty. Amazing tub abd hot tub.
reviews/5/comments:
Excellent place to come “home” to after long days of exploring Vail. The backyard view along with the peaceful sound of the river was the highlight. The jetted tub and hot tub were perks. The kitchen is fully stocked. And Spence was an excellent host, responding promptly and going out of his way to make our stay positive!

The king bed gets a “C” and we’d encourage future guests to bring their favorite pillow if you have strong preferences.
reviews/6/comments:
I love this place. It’s just minutes from phenomenal hikes and the apartment itself is gorgeous and spacious.
Spence the host is very gracious.

My favorite thing about it is you can leave the doors wide open and listen to the sound of the eagle river flowing by.

The bathtub and the hot tub overlooking the river are also awesome!
And so are the river-stone fireplaces.

You won’t regret choosing this place — it’s excellent in so many ways.
reviews/7/comments: This was our second time staying here and it was just as amazing as we remembered. It’s the perfect place to stay in the Vail Valley offering easy access to everything in the area.
reviews/8/comments: We really enjoyed our stay at the Grouse Creek Inn!  The space is thoughtfully arranged and really comfortable--with so many amenities. We felt like we were staying in the home of good friends. You also can't beat the location: right on the Eagle River (sleep with the windows open!), a short walk from downtown Minturn, and near to Vail, Beaver Creek, Avon, and Edwards. So much to explore right out the front door!
reviews/9/comments: We had a fantastic long-term stay at Spence’s Airbnb! The home is right on the river, incredibly equipped, and so relaxing. Minturn is a gem of a town and so close to Vail and Edwards. Spence and his family were wonderful. Could not recommend this home more!

name: #5 Private Cozy Dog Friendly Room in Downtown Lead
reviews/0/comments: Great cozy place for a getaway to the mountains. Room was clean and had all the amenities of home. Really appreciated the complementary soft drinks and french press coffee.
reviews/1/comments: Super clean with great water pressure!
reviews/2/comments: My family and I had an amazing overnight stay. First off, Ting the host was so great with communication when we needed a place in a pinch. The place was clean, affordable, and perfectly located. The self-check in process was very easy as well! We will definitely be back in the future, thank you again Ting!
reviews/3/comments: Lots to love about this place. It was quiet, cozy, and conveniently close (one third of a mile) to the LT100 starting line.  When I arrived, there was a fan pulling fresh air into the room, an essential oil diffuser running (with a very subtle and pleasant aroma), and bird noise chirping from a white noise machine. The fridge/freezer was handy; I was able to stock it with groceries and avoid eating out too much. I didn’t get a chance to use the shared kitchen, but that was a nice feature as well. Adding this to my short list of places to stay next time I’m in Leadville!
reviews/4/comments: I will definitely stay here again next time I am in Leadville.  Clean, cute, pleasant.
reviews/5/comments: Our stay in Leadville was wonderful! The place was clean and the entry was easy to use. The host communicated well with us and answered any questions that we had! We would stay there again!!
reviews/6/comments: This place is amazing! Ting was so sweet & has thought of everything a guest could want during their stay in Leadville!
reviews/7/comments: Great stay!
reviews/8/comments: Great stay. The room was very nice and location perfect.
reviews/9/comments:
5 STARS across the board!

Amazing communication all the way around and what a cute and homey room!

From the goodie bag to the birds chirping, it was the little things that set this place apart!

My wife’s birthday is in February and I can’t wait to bring her here and stay once again.

Thanks for the personalized stay and opening your place to us.

name: Cozy 1 BR/1BA W Fenced in Backyard
reviews/0/comments: Great location for autumn leaf peeping! The aspens are just starting to turn golden in the area. Brian’s place is so cozy, quiet and well taken care of. I’ve stayed there several times over the years and it just gets better and better each time.
reviews/1/comments: We had a good stay at Brian's place in Leadville. The kitchen has recently been re-done and the proximity to downtown Leadville was excellent.
reviews/2/comments: Perfect place to stay for 2 plus a pup! The fenced in backyard was such a great perk. The property is super convenient to town and to so many outdoor activities. We will definitely look to stay here again in the future.
reviews/3/comments: We had a great stay at this home and loved the fenced in yard!
reviews/4/comments: Great location, price, and responsive host!
reviews/5/comments: Rustic ski cabin best for a couple. Comfortable and warm gas stove fireplace. Large backyard that is fully fenced and secure for our dog to enjoy. Quiet neighborhood, close to grocery store and short drive to downtown area.
reviews/6/comments: Great host. Great place. Perfect location.
reviews/7/comments: Brian's place was really great to pull into after a long day of biking. It had everything you need for a good stay. And we enjoyed watching a movie on disc!
reviews/8/comments: Beautiful home in a beautiful town! House is perfect size for a couple with a nice kitchen to cook in. If you dont like to cook there are many nice restaurants in the town to eat at! I would definitely recommend this home to others!
reviews/9/comments: Comfy house with a fenced in backyard great for dogs. Nice quiet street, great host.

name: The Hilltop Haven 2bd Suite + Pet Friendly!
reviews/0/comments: Made us excited to return to Leadville!
reviews/1/comments: Cozy apartment, with an easy walk into town. Was very convenient for eating out and exploring the side streets
reviews/2/comments: Great stay!
reviews/3/comments: Nicely remodeled unit and comfortable. Had issues with going up and down steps to get to the unit which we did not see on the site. Wish we would have been better informed as we have a senior dog and myself having mobility issues. Also, there is a $50 fee plus shipping if you leave something behind. I wasn't able to go back and check myself because of my mobility issues so because my hubby didn't see our items they will be left. No fault of Nadim at all but I think the $50 fee is a bit steep.
reviews/3/response:
Hi Juli,
Thanks for sharing your feedback with us. We have updated the listing. As for shipping back the lost and found items, our cleaners have to spend their time going to the post office and packaging the items. Thank you
reviews/4/comments: Great place and fantastic views and amenities. Walking distance to Leadville and restaurants. Very clean and great communication from host. Everything you need is in the space.
reviews/5/comments: Lovely property.
reviews/6/comments: Great place and location
reviews/7/comments: Great, quiet location in Leadville with beautiful Mountain View’s. Beds are very comfy and unit has a very nice kitchen!
reviews/8/comments: Great place. Definitely on our list of places to use again.
reviews/9/comments: Great location, easily walkable and right on the Leadville race course. Our stay was smooth and communication from the host was excellent. The home is set up with everything you need for a comfortable stay.

name: Marriott StreamSide at Birch, Vail, Studio max 4
reviews/0/comments: Tara's place is great. It was clean and well furnished. Quiet and comfy.
reviews/1/comments: Beautiful accommodation, great location and very relaxing. Very easy check-in, clear communication and super clean spot. Would highly recommend!
reviews/2/comments: Tara was great to deal with.  Very easy and effortless. The studio at the Marriott was as it was described and a great value.
reviews/3/comments: Great place
reviews/4/comments: Great place and location!!
reviews/5/comments: Make sure to ask if you will be in a studio apartment or regular apartment. Was clean well organized room ! Suited our needs for one night! Price was great too!
reviews/6/comments: Exactly as promised. Cute, cozy studio in the heart of Vail.
reviews/7/comments: Great place to stay in Veil. I really enjoyed the room & deck area.
reviews/8/comments: Great host and a great place to stay.  Would recommend 100%.
reviews/9/comments: My girlfriend and I stayed 1 night here very last minute. Great value. Nice balcony, comfy couch/tv/fireplace area, and the bed was surprisingly comfortable. Murphy beds have come a long way. We'll be back!

name: Sunlight Mountain Getaway - Ivy's Run
reviews/0/comments: A cool place! It’s off the beaten path, but you might just see some wildlife (we saw a young bear snacking on the side of the road)! Ivy’s Run gave us more than enough room to set up our kiddo’s pack n play and for our two pups. The dining area and fridge were very convenient and the check-in might be the easiest process ever. We’ll definitely go back.
reviews/1/comments: If you are looking for a groovy community lodge to visit, definitely check this place out! I absolutely loved the location and how dog friendly this is. I will for sure be checking this place out when the snow comes.
reviews/2/comments:
This place is an ultimate get-away. Great location, serene, and perfect for relaxation.
Highly recommended!
reviews/3/comments: It's really awesome. If you want a get away and relax it's perfect. The rooms were so nice it felt like home. We arrived really late when everything was dark. But woke up with this beautiful view. You can bring your own food and cook in their kitchen there's also refrigerators where you can put your stuff. I can only recommend and would stay there again. Thank you. Also thanks to Pedro for making me coffee in the morning 😁
reviews/4/comments: The place is rugged and no frills but perfectly clean and welcoming. The service was excellent, with fresh lemon water, ice, snacks and continental breakfast always magically replenished before empty. I would stay here again!
reviews/4/response: Thanks Denise, glad you enjoyed your visit.  Cheers
reviews/5/comments: Exactly what we were looking for, a retreat in the moubtains by the water.  A hidden gem for those who enjoy nature adventures during the day but a comfortable bed at night.  We decided to stay an extra night and would have stayed another month, if our schedules  would permit.  Simple yet comfortable  accommodations in one of the prettiest locations.  The inn was nostalgic of a time gone by but so memorable in my heart and soul.  The smell and artifacts took me back to my childhood.  A simple time of cabins and board games without technology everywhere. Be sure and bring your food.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  Close to everything yet far enkugh away.
reviews/6/comments: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place close to Sunlight Mountain to get some spring skiing in and this was perfect. We walked from our room to the lift and had a great time on the mountain. The place itself has an old feel but I think this adds to the charm :) would definitely recommend!
reviews/7/comments:
We had an amazing time at The Sunlight Mountain Inn. We stayed in Ivy’s Run. The bed was very comfortable and it had amazing views of Sunlight Mountain. We were able to walk directly up to the lifts and had a great time skiing. The shower had incredibly hot water, which was a huge plus.

Also, there was music down in the basement area one of the nights in the evening, which was very cool. Lots of cozy areas to relax outside of the room as well. We opted to buying breakfast every morning, but the kitchen area was supplied with breakfast items and everything was very clean.

I’d say the only downside was that the walls were a little thin, so occasionally you could hear other people. But this wasn’t something that impacted us as everyone was incredibly respectful of the quiet hours. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews/8/comments: Altai's listing in AirBNB was accurate, clean, and exactly what we needed to get away for a ski weekend. We can't recommend staying here enough!
reviews/9/comments: The place is so great! The common area was awesome and had live music during the weekend. The locals who live at the inn are so nice and helpful! Altai was great with communicating and was very accommodating. And the views were breathtaking! We had an amazing time and would definitely go back :)

name: Cabin 07 PETS OK 🐾Rustic Old West Studio+Kitchen
reviews/0/comments: Great little cabin, very clean and well-stocked. All of the amenities were there as advertised, as well as a few little extras. The bed was very comfortable and bedding was clean, the hosts were easy to communicate with, and the bathroom was clean as well. Really nice cabins!
reviews/1/comments:
Great location! We enjoyed our stay and liked spending time in the outside area, it was so nice to have our dog with us 😊
It is quite small, and I noticed a lot of dog hair. Very clean otherwise!
reviews/2/comments: Enjoyed a great 2 night stay with our dog. Had nice grassy area for the dog, cabin was clean and cozy. Overall a great experience.
reviews/3/comments: This was perfect for us as we were passing through Glenwood Springs! Cozy little cabin within walking distance from some local food shops. Definitely worth a stay!
reviews/4/comments: Cute little spot SO close to town! A great get away spot for my fiance and I. Easy access & very clean inside. Tight quarters but it was truly all we needed!
reviews/5/comments: Cozy little cabin!  It was great for a quick night’s rest on our driving journey.
reviews/6/comments: Our 1 night stay was just what we needed, just a stop to sleep and shower the next morning before getting on the road again.  The kerig coffee was nice as well!!!!!!
reviews/7/comments: We stayed for two nights with our dog. it was as described. Kitchen was stocked enough for us to cook a few meals. The yard was great for our dog. Internet was good for streaming tv.
reviews/8/comments: Great stay, very nice!
reviews/9/comments: Great location and super chill place to stay. Quiet and respectful guests and perfect for us to have our fur child. Simple and small but everything you need! Highly recommend and would stay again!

name: Log cabin in the mountains!
reviews/0/comments:
Several things that I enjoyed about the cabin:
The cabin was clean.
The ability to use a clothes washer and dryer was handy.
The cabin was close to several restaurants and small tourism type businesses.
The street was quiet at night.
The books in the bookshelves were fun to look over. There was a range of topics. I read parts of two or three books.
The cabin was stocked with several games, and puzzles.
Overall, the cabin and its amenities were impressive.
reviews/1/comments: The location was perfect!  Very easy and quick walk to downtown!
reviews/2/comments: We spent a few days in Glenwood Springs with our kids (7 and 10 years old). The cabin was perfect for us.  The communication with Mike and Allison was smoothness. Glenwood Springs was a stop on a four week trip so the washing machine was a big plus for us.  The kitchen is very well equipped. We came by train and were pleased how walkable Glenwood Springs is. We would have loved to stay longer!
reviews/3/comments: A perfectly quaint, well stocked cabin. Very near downtown and the hiking trail to Doc Holliday’s grave.  Easy check in/check out at Noon, which is so rare!! The cabin was sparkly clean and the neighborhood is very quiet. Plenty of parking right in front of the cabin. My only “complaint” would be that a second window air conditioner in the other bedroom would have been fabulous. Summer temps reached 99 degrees during the day, and the cabin was quite warm. There were box fans, which we ran non stop during our stay, as well as portable fans we brought with us.  Allison went above and beyond to get my bed pillows returned to me after I inadvertently left them behind. We will definitely return to this cabin on our next trip to Glenwood! Thank you Mike and Allison for a wonderful, quaint stay at your place!
reviews/4/comments:
If you are unsure of this cabin/house don't be. This is a great place to stay and I recommend this to anyone over a hotel. The house was spotless! They have tons of kitchen tools to eat in. We slept great, I thought the bed would be too firm but I slept like a baby. Allison was very attentive and responded to all of my questions within a few minutes. The only thing I can complain about is the heat. The last evening the house got to like 84 degrees and it didn't drop below that until 10 pm. All of the other nights it was great!

Thanks Mike and Allison for a great stay.
reviews/5/comments:
Wonderful location in a super quaint neighborhood. We walked almost everywhere and really enjoyed it. Don’t miss the nearby graveyard hike. I forget the name but it’s right there and a wonderful evening hike for us. Mike has it posted somewhere.
The cabin is comfortable and great for hanging out when your not on the go. It had everything we needed and then some.
Highly recommend.
reviews/6/comments: Great location, right near downtown and definitely walkable. We also enjoyed the back porch and made good use of the grill and the well equipped kitchen. Quick communication and super easy check in and out.
reviews/7/comments: Mike and Allison were excellent hosts, gave me great information about the area. The house was very nice and comfortable. I would definitely come back
reviews/8/comments: Absolutely amazing!! Would stay here agin for sure! Mike and Allison were great! They were so sweet and helpful.
reviews/9/comments: This was a great cozy cabin in Glenwood Springs! It is in a very convenient location in a residential area, where we were able to walk to the restaurants and shops nearby.

address: Redstone Historic District, Colorado, United States
name: Villa On The Boulevard
reviews/0/comments: Clean, comfortable, and in such a lovely location!
reviews/1/comments: Lovely place! Had a great time - thank you!
reviews/2/comments: Simply Amazing! This is my favorite Airbnb! The location is perfection! We had everything we needed and more! We will be back! The outside area by the river is so peaceful and beautiful! The historic Redstone is  like a step back in time with all the amenities of today! Loved it!
reviews/3/comments: The location on the river is beautiful, we loved the outdoor patio area!  The unit was super clean and we had everything we needed. Very quiet area!  Great communication-thank you!  It was better than expected and such a sweet space. The pull out sofa bed was pretty comfortable as well!  Thank you!  Perfect spot!
reviews/4/comments: This was a delightful weekend stay and perfect for relaxing at the nearby hot springs or along the river in the back yard. It is a spacious 1 bedroom with great kitchen equipment. Highly recommend!
reviews/5/comments: My family and I absolutely loved our stay at this location. The decor was very nice and everything was very clean. Any questions we had we had prompt responses from Nicole. The views and location were just phenomenal. We look forward to visiting again.
reviews/6/comments: Such a great place to stay! Even better in person. And Redstone is such a nice cute little town , had such a great time here.
reviews/7/comments: The rooms and location are so welcoming and beautiful! Would love to come again!
reviews/8/comments:
Nicole’s place was very clean and cozy. I didn’t have a problem with cleanliness on this trip. It was freshly cleaned and vacuumed, bathroom spotless which I loved. The king bed is big and the love seat and couch are plush enough to sleep on without pulling the bed out. The place looks bigger in person than the pictures. The only issue is that there is no service and the spotty wifi connectivity because we are in the Valley and
right on the river. I recommend putting in your route on GPS before leaving the house. Nonetheless it wasn’t too big of a problem and the views made up for it. It is a scenic, quiet area with little shops next door. I would stay here again !
reviews/9/comments: What a great place to stay for peace and relaxation! Clean, cozy and cute! Plus, breath-taking mountains and stream outdoors. Nicole, the host, was great at communicating any time we had a question. A great place to get away and bask in a peaceful area of Colorado!
